hYZ68TxsDoyZIFwmlboI5A.text: Great Mexican food, reasonable prices.  After work i picked up the two shredded beef tacos with rice & beans (comes with chips & salsa) it was under 13.00 for two dinners and was great with a Redbox.

7eHOQwpO4xKTTehcBr_bEg.text: Met some friends for happy hour and WOW did we get happy!!!!!! Small bar area with lots of regulars. The margs are pre made unless you do a call tequila and they have some very good ones. The bartender knows how to mix a happy hour drink!!!!! She was funny and entertained us. Salsa is very good chips are fresh and mini chimi's are a great appetizer.

vie5Wt2rvMyVC6SWrsczYQ.text: Cheap margaritas. Check. Walking distance. Check. Overall, it's fast and fresh Mexican deliciousness with super duper service.

Xu7IDBo_CX1ekmcWmfEYrg.text: We have a friend that lives near the downtown phoenix area, so a good excuse to try out Mi patio for lunch. I ordered the chicken tacos with rice and beans, and the chicken was juicy and well seasoned. I ate every bite! Mr H. had the green chili burrito with rice and beans and our friend also had the green chili burrito.  I did sample the burrito and it was very tasty.  I was impressed  how quickly the food comes out, and they were very good about refilling our chips & salsa and drinks.      My first visit but it won't be my last one! I left satisfied and next time I might try the margarita's.

r25a7FMGzNWe215-N7Pn8A.text: Great food, wonderful service, fair prices. Always hot fresh chips and delicious salsa waiting for you. Drinks are always refilled. Attentive staff. What could be better?   I love the decor, but my kitchen is also decorated with the chili peppers. :)   I've eaten here 3 times now, each time has completely satisfied my tummy, taste buds and my dislike for bad service. This means, I will keep going back and bring new people to try it out!!

zVGC48032oW3O9Bn_uLf9w.text: Been addicted to Mi Patio for years. Always excellent food, yummy chips n salsa. Awesome margaritas! The service is always amazing. One of the neighborhood's best kept secrets.Thanks for always taking care of us!

KnhmI20l75_aREWsTskJ9w.text: Stopped in here for lunch based on the reviews... and based on the sign that said they have $1.75 margaritas all day every day (don't judge, I had had a rough day).  Was greeted as soon as I walked in, and a server showed me to a table right away and took my drink order ($1.75 margarita please).  The margarita came quickly and it did not lack booze.  I ordered off their "Specials" menu and got the Baja Chicken Burro, and asked for beans instead of rice (no problem with the request).  While waiting for the food, I couldn't help eating a bowl and a half of their salsa.  Mmmmmm, mmmmm, good.  I told myself 2 or 3 times that it would be my last chip, but I kept going each time because the salsa was just damn good.  The food came out soon after - big portion, and all very tasty (although I have to admit, the chicken itself was a little bland, but the cream cheese sauce and loads of salsa was a saving grace).  I'm pretty sure I licked the beans off the plate... don't judge.  Did I mention I had had a rough day??  Although the chicken didn't impress, everything else I had did, so this place is a winner in my book.  How could you not love a place with $1.75 margaritas?

b77oq98GyjYPSNz6w4KLIg.text: Best neighborhood bar!!! Great prices ! Huge portions! Awesome bartenders!! A must try!

bTuRazRKt8buSRO-Lg_oxA.text: I have a simple life, big and small, soft and crispy, full of obvious contradictions and some surprising incarnations. The life of a tortilla is much like anyone else full of glamour, large family drama and constant transformation. I'd like to share that story with you here today, my life as a tortilla.  Ever since being a young kernel of corn I've know I was different from the rest of the ear. While the other kernels longed to be cereal and ethanol, I knew that I wanted to be a star. Celebrated each and every day, giving promise of a brighter and tastier future. Then it happened, I was suddenly plucked, mashed, rolled and pressed, being transformed from the ugly duckling into the beautiful swan I always knew I was. Destined for greatness in the kitchen of Mi Patio, I knew it was all coming True for I am the corn tortilla.  From the second you walk in the door of my home, you can sense my presence. Bold colors, comfortable seating and smiling faces were all there to celebrate my life and times. As soon as you are seated a hot, lightly salty and crispy bowl of me is sat onto the table. They've cut me into triangles so I'm easier to handle, then I'm deep-fried golden and simply beautiful. My 2 friends, Mild and Spicy, are a couple of salsas that love to hang out all over me. Go ahead, grab me and dip me deep into one of them, slather me in their tomato goodness, I deserve it as much as you do. I have another friend, the cold and refreshing Margarita ($1.75), who simply completes me. Enjoy them slowly while the wandering minstrels play requests from my motherland of Mexico, this would bring a joyful tear to me eye, if I had one.  On the menu you can find many of my brothers, sisters and cousins. My cousin Quesapilla ($6.35) is a real show off though his beginnings are quite humble. Some also call him native fry bread but I just call him a crowd pleasure. Stuffed with gobs of cheese and griddled until melted and bubbly, he tastes just as good as he looks. Spoon on some fresh pico de gallo and you'll see why the ladies swoon and the men groom. My sister from another mother, Quesadilla ($5.95) is a total sweetheart. She's wide, thin and crispy all covered with cheese and I mean that in the nicest possible way. She, Mild and Spicy have a triad relationship, all complementing one another in each melted bite.  Baja Chicken Burro ($8.35) is one of my favorite uncles. He's the uncle who shows up delicious and golden brown, draped in an outrageous creamy coat of sour cream and cilantro, Id have to say he is all about glamour and fashion. Much like season 1 of Project Runway where Jay McCarroll and Wendy Pepper would cat fight every single week, my uncle Baja simply does not get along with auntie Huevos Rancheros ($8.35), a snide but delicious bitch. Her fluffy eggs are perfectly cooked, her delicious Ranchero sauce and her rice and beans make for a satisfying anytime platter.  Not liking to sound like a total me-me, I do have to say that I taste pretty good wrapped around Carne Asada con Pico de Gallo ($11.75). Tender steak grilled to a nice medium and served with pico de gallo, rice and beans. All you have to do is fill me up with some of your juicy meat and it's a win-win scenario. I get to soak up your meat juice and you get to eat all 6" of my round deliciousness.  Every family has a black sheep and mine is no exception. Coming from a Greek father and a Mexican mother, Gyros Chimi ($8.50), is one of mystery and excitement. Inside she is full of tender slices of roasted gyro meat, gently deep fried then she's covered in the perfect accessory, creamy cucumber sauce. To add to her difference she is served with a hearty baked zucchini complete with sliced onion and a rich tomato sauce. You'll have no idea what you're getting yourself into until you take your first bite, delish.  Unlike auntie Huevos, the Chorizo and Egg Burro ($6.55), is tasty and uncomplicated. Any chance I get to soak in sauce I'm so there! Try the #106 Beef Taco, Cheese Enchilada, Rice & Beans ($8.55) for a celebration of soak. Stuffed with cheese then covered in a slightly sweet and spicy sauce I taste real good if I can say so myself. I also enjoy being bent over, deep-fried then filled with beef and topped with lettuce and tomatoes. One bite into my crunchy exterior exposes my goods for you to enjoy completely.  I'm a firm believer that a meal is never complete without something sugary, it doesn't have to be too big. Fry bread with Cinnamon & Honey ($3.25) is sticky and sweet cousin of mine, who I like to call Fannie. Like my other cousin Quesapilla, she's golden brown, chewy and drizzled with honey and a sprinkle of cinnamon. After tasting Fannie, you might wonder why you've never given her a taste before?  Now that I've been able to share so much of myself with you here today, I feel a great peace and inner joy that can only be brought out by my loyal fans. In whatever form I take from a taco to a warm steamy basket know this, I am here for u.

syiCwPOhMXkm8ZJolaSfZg.text: Sooooo Good!!!  When I ate the rice and beans, it was like having mi Abuela in the kitchen . The shredded beef taco and cheese enchilada special was DELISH!!!!!  I will absolutely go there again and again!!!!

-tnyEi11TksSBHcp2_1ifQ.text: One of ourfavorite local spots! Good, simple Mexican food. I always get crunchy chicken tacos. The chips and salsa are always flowing. We've experienced some inconsistencies in the salsa, wayyyy too salty every few trips. Always friendly, fast service! Wish there was a patio. :)

ZzHZHaByR779GMhv9sydBQ.text: I have never given anyone a five star review i dont think. This place has rocking food period!

3HFRISEUkanN0ZnoWJ4lzg.text: Definitely one of the best and my favorite Mexican restaurants in the greater phoenix area. I've literally eaten here two nights in a row: the service is always awesome, everyone is so nice. I've tried many things on the menu and have never been disappointed, it's all SO GOOD. I'm not a vegetarian but they have amazing vegetarian options that even I get sometimes. Seriously, why go to filibertos or some place like that when you can get restaurant service for practically the same price, AND you get bottomless chips and salsa AND the food is better. Great good, great prices, great people/service, never probably go to another Mexican restaurant in Phoenix.

_qO1pvuRpg_cRn63m8CraA.text: I'm upping my review one star for two reasons. #1 I just remembered that Mi Patio is a dedicated parter to KAET. Despite the long drive, they consistently donate food for 50 to 75 people during each of KAETs four yearly pledge drives. It's not often you find an establishment committed to the betterment of the entire community!  For that they get another star in my book.  The 2nd reason is service. It doesn't matter how busy this place is, you are always greated by a smile, served super fast, checked on throughout your meal, etc. They really do excel at service!

CRfK23N8-5DRcWl-G7106g.text: Service was very good. We were able to be seated right away on a Saturday evening. They gave us a complimentary dessert shot . I loved the salsa...not too hot though very addictive. My entre was delicious with lots of chicken.  Prices are very affordable.

O-6wTo3ex6VLcRbOZglm3Q.text: Reasonably priced, excellent, fresh food, and excellent, speedy service. What more could you ask for?  I had one of the combo meals (#100), which came with a cheese enchilada, beef tamale, and a beef taco (I substituted a chicken taco), rice, and beans.  All of the food was amazing, but my favorite was the tamale.  The cornmeal/masa was amazing and soft and just delicious.  I highly recommend this place!

vg5njToQkGl8mV3JG9Os5g.text: YUM YUM YUM YUM YUM. Friends in town from Ohio! What better visitor friendly Mexican place could you POSSIBLY take visitors from the midwest? MI PATIO!!!!  Extensive menu, bursting with flavor, and chock-full-of-choices in the realm of Mexican comfort food. Reasonable prices, super friendly and quick service, and $1.75 MARGARITAS. ZING!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Love the location, the vibe, and the classic Mexigrub restaraunt decor!!! Finally the SALSA is killer!

-wmQ2Hagt-vHHJhcesz65A.text: This place has the best deal on Mexican food in town. You definitely get what you pay for, and it's authentic.

MOvWsN2dqrmIy2eDfK6-ow.text: Add me to the chorus of people who do not understand the effusive praise this place receives from the majority of Yelp reviewers.  I've been here twice. Both times, the food was solid, but nothing special. I tried the flautas the first time, and a combo plate with chile relleno, cheese enchilada, and beef taco on the second visit. They do give you a lot of food absolutely smothered in cheese, and the prices are moderate. (Doubtful you're getting out of here for under $10/person after tax and tip.) The margaritas are $1.75, but of course very small and full of ice...I wouldn't expect anything different at that price. The horchata is delicious and made with real milk.  So the food is okay, maybe slightly above average. The service seems to be hit-or-miss. The first time I went, I sat at the bar and the service was great and friendly. The second time, however, I brought my girlfriend and we sat at a table. The server couldn't have been much more rude - he was extremely short with us. He basically acted like we were wasting his time and was not friendly at all. The younger guys did come around and keep our chips and salsa well-stocked, but it couldn't make up for the attitude we got from the server in my mind. Maybe he was just having a bad day, but you shouldn't take that out on your customers in any circumstance.  Average food and hit-or-miss service makes Mi Patio a 3-star locale...I really can't imagine rating them any higher.

w0SRBSk39NJT4Pe59WGVwA.text: Not quite Teepee but nonetheless, a great Mexican joint.   We came here after a volunteer event with my work and had a larger group. We were seated within 5 minutes and drink orders taken immediately. We also had individual salsa cups and chips (a little dry) for the whole table fairly quickly as well which I appreciated as most of us were hungry.   With what the chips lacked, the salsa more than made up for. I swear, I could've drank it. It was SPOT ON.   The service was great. No one (to my knowledge) had empty drinks and our food came out pretty fast considering we had a large group. I ordered the cheese enchilada and it was delicious - though not comparable to the cheese enchiladas at Teepee. My only con was that I wish I ordered two instead of one!  Would go back if I was in the area. Would like to try some of their margs in the future!

PDxGwwgMC64YL1OeKA3y1A.text: I'm surprised this place has such high reviews. We have been eating Mexican food in the valley for 60 years. We got take out last night. We had tacos, an enchilada, a green chili burro and a chili relleno.  This was so bad that we didn't finish it - we threw it away. That's bad because I hate throwing food away. We will never eat this food again.

ccDnw24w2WqSj1xYTdXO4Q.text: I just moved to Arizona for school about a year ago and the first time I came to Mi Patio was with a friend of mine and her family. I can now say I have been back at least a dozen more times throughout the year with different (or the same) people and everyone I have brought with me has loved it! It is my favorite Mexican restaurant in Phoenix! The shredded beef tacos with rice and beans is my favorite dish, and it always comes straight off the grill hot and delicious. Excellent prices, AMAZING food, and extraordinary and hardworking employees and owners! I always leave a little too full, but with complete satisfaction!

vSOIssjOhHcY8SQpm92UGQ.text: The staff is very friendly and helpful, very clean and wonderful place to eat. Everyone was exceptional at making sure we had everything we needed.

cbmHST2E5mHh3MMXdtJqcw.text: I used to eat at the location in Phoenix YEARS ago, but recently tried the Tempe location (closer to home).  Had the tortilla soup which was really pretty outstanding.  They brought a bowl of chicken, cheese and cilantro and poured hot broth over it.  It was, perhaps, a tad salty (not a big salt person), but overall was amazing (and filling!)  The salsa was great.  My companion had chicken nachos which rivaled Tia Rosa's (my other favorite Mexican restaurant).  Great  Now I have TWO to choose from.

VhYhZTbCxJ01Yc8SWUB1PA.text: The horchata here is a slushy delightfulness! Can't go wrong with the crunchy chips and salsa! Efficient service, you could go during your lunch and have enough time. I tried several things on their menu; tacos, tostadas, tamales, burritos, etc, and nothing has disappointed. Generous on the cheese, which I love!!!

dYcqdzrI1x6r8rqM6msKOA.text: Maybe we went on a bad night bc our food was sooo bad. We ordered and the food was out in 3 minutes ( microwave food). I don't know how this place has such good reviews. La pinata is 10000x better. Save your money, avoid a stomach ache and go there if you're craving good Mexican food.

JMutz2ylbCOzIQLao0Dk6A.text: I tried the restaurant after reading the reviews. It was a nice, clean, quaint place. The male server I had was somewhat in a go,go,go mode. He spoke fast, acted fast and wanted my input fast. I asked him for his input on the Patio Chimi and he replied in a hurried way that it came as beef or chicken, which would I like? I began to ask him again and he basically told me it's either beef or chicken, which do you want? He wasn't interested in giving me any input about the Chimi. I choose chicken. I also provided if there was a hot choice I'd take it. He just looked funny at me as he walked away.  The older Senoira that brought chips and salsa was truly a sweet person with a warming and friendly persona. She was cheerful and enjoyable each time she came to my table. The Senoira at the entry area was also very friendly and cheerful. My male server was the only one that made me feel like I was an inconvenience. He couldn't slow down enough to be friendly and I don't think he cared to. The  place was busy but no other staff were acting in such a way. The others were attentive but friendly while doing so.   The Chimi had a unique taste that was an enjoyable change from the normal chicken chimi, but it wasn't spicy hot at all. Quite "Gringo" as far as spiciness goes. It was also soft like a burrito though instead of having that wonderful crispy exterior. It was smothered but that wasn't causing the soft exterior. The rice was done well, soft but not mushy with good flavor. The dish also came with a side of unseasoned/flavored shredded cabbage but since I like cabbage it was refreshing.  All in all it was an acceptable lunch. Prior to choosing Mi Patio I was considering going to Los Dos Molinos but thought I would try something new and Mi Patio had good ratings. I like hot food and Los Dos, still, has the best!  Mi Patio's food was fine but it isn't on par with Los Dos Molino's food. I'll continue going to Los Dos Molinos for my Mexican food cravings.

tiQiCU9mW5wQHuZg-GoUZg.text: The food was great! Friendly atmosphere, my tea glass never got empty and they kept refilling the salsa and chips (which were free).  You get a lot of food and the prices are not that high. I will definitely be going  back to this place in the near future.

YL2kG96kRh1FNdepN6rpbw.text: I love the complimentary salsa here and $2 Margarita's.  They have a long list of menu you can choose from, I have tried Chicken Burro, Veggie Burrito and they are good. Only thing I don't like about this place is they put lot of cheese in everything even after saying easy on cheese.  This place is always busy and most of the time has waiting for happy hours and lunch.

TUtFDrVD9jWRLXvfriNBRg.text: The salsa is the best. They even have extra hot which I love. Specials are always great option from the norm.  Last visit I had the Albondigas Soup... Outstanding!  Been here at least 5 times and always leave happy! Great drink specials and just a fun little place with great Phoenix history!  Value, great food, and friendly service makes this a local favorite for me!

e6bSB2u2HqO7Y2n2tV7Iig.text: Far from being authentic. First and last visit. It can improve and be better if: beans are not 100% covered with cheese; tacos should not be wrapped in foil; carne asada for tacos should be sliced smaller; salsa was bland, not spicy enough; carne asada was not tasty at all. Sorry, just being honest...

cO1kOe5_zuihZlp7uzuHxg.text: The server was awesome! Friendly and welcoming & they were nice with the bottomless chips & salsa but the food..... ordered a spinach & feta enchilada & I think the spinach was rotten. Also, asked for green chili sauce & it looks like slop. I don't like to give bad reviews but just a heads up to the vegetarians who enjoy spicy out there. This might not be the place for you.... maybe jus have a drink & find food elsewhere.  They DID give us free shots & a buy one get one free entree card to make up for their faults so that was appreciative. Try them out, your experience might be different than ours.

VCIjqlKa-MSMgjGlwnO5sg.text: My husband and I were in the mid Phoenix area on Sunday 7/23 and decided to have lunch at Mi Patio. We had an Entertainment book coupon and had no problem using it. I had the chili relleno plate with no rice, but add garnish (lettuce/tomatoes). The relleno was packed with cheese and the sauce was a perfect amount without overpowering the chili flavor. I received a good portion of lettuce. My husband had the combination plate (enchilada, tostada and taco). The food was very tasty and plentiful. He brought the tostada home. Our drink glasses never got more than half empty and the the salsa and chips get flowing. I am very glad we tried this place and will be back when i that area of town again.

j2rMc4vUCPKqCrlOvBMJOA.text: Was just looking for a place to hang while a friend was having tests done at the local hospital and stumbled upon this venue. Been here for decades and is a treasure hidden in plain sight. To be honest, I have not eaten here yet, but if the chips and salsa are any indication, I'm sure the rest of the food is excellent as well. This review is more about the staff and ambience.  Leslie and Tammie are treasures and the place has a warm neighborhood feel to it.  I will definitely stop in again when I am passing through town!  PS Kristin is the BEST!

U9wME4t3w9ih3OfmDS5LKg.text: Loved this place! The service, food and prices were all good- especially the $2.50 margaritas.

1Uop7YnkJtbbFfmZ-ETHHA.text: I went there today for the first time because I had to try his $2.50 Margarita. I must say that it was pretty damn good!! A little sweet and strong (I was impressed). There salsa is flavorful, and has a slight kick to it. I ordered chicken enchiladas, one with green salsa and another with red salsa. Overall, in my opinion the enchiladas were standard (nothing too special). I would like to come back to try other items on their menu, especially the chimichanga that looked AMAZING!   In regards to the service I give 5 stars. The staff was very polite and attentive even while they were very busy. Extremely quick service and I barely waited 5 minutes for my food even while they were busy.   Overall, fantastic service, chips/salsa, and margaritas. The enchilada was mediocre. I would comeback.

rAAWNKJgk5R0tMoEQDkX0Q.text: Delicious food and excellent wait staff. The food is fresh and comes out quick, hot and delicious! A great Mexican can restirant!!!!

Ms2ElLZWC3Q8MJdpKx_I_w.text: Been coming here for years, used work and live in that area.  Some staff been there years, some not but I find the food be tasty and fresh.  Samantha's healthy burrito and the chicken tacos are really good.  The $2.99 margaritas are tasty but pretty much no alcohol, but refreshing.  ****Alert, there is a heavy set female Hispanic server there on nights, no nice, not pleasant, always dread her.  Tonight she was there again, zero personality and she reminds me of a women's prison guard, she wears ugly ripped up jeans.  Why do they keep her, she is horrible!!!    Everyone else is quite nice there  Avoid her, she sucks!!

XwuD0E5E_Mkpyf8mEuLS5A.text: The service was great. I loved the chicks and salsa and that's about it. We ordered guacamole and they brought us some store bought cold paste. My Carne Assad burrito was lacking. It was just packed with huge onions and sour cream along with the meat. I was not impressed at all. Granted I'm from Los Angeles, home of the best Mexican food aside from Mexico itself. I was just so disappointed because a friend of mine talked nonstop about how great they were. Her tamale did look good however, just not the burritos.

UOyYxVLzf5EiMdRU1CQ5wQ.text: Great food and Friendly People. Mi Patio- Mi Gente! We order lunch from Mi Patio all the time and everyone at work loves the food.

z39YrKkWiGRJUWmRyGd8bg.text: MI Patio is fantastic, the staff are great.  My family has been going there for years. Their salsa is so good and they keep it full.  My favorite Mexican restaurant in Phoenix.

geA2U82Fc71zw9Re8ryvtA.text: Love this place. Fast and friendly service. The spinach and feta chimi is delicious and they have excellent salsa and chips. I will definitely be going back.

2hIvO8JLJWgFDxdkQlB5lQ.text: Service is great, the food use to be pretty good, recently went there we gave the food 3 stars, tops. The $1.99 margarita use to be pretty good in the past,  it was obvious it had tequila in it. We stopped by 4/30/2016 very disappointed, after 2 margaritas felt nothing, no buzz at all, it was just a sweet lemon aid drink with salt on the rim. Pretty disappointed with the whole drinking and eating experience.   We have several Mexican restaurants closer to home that has way better food and margaritas, compared to what we got served recently at Mi Patio.

ed-i7Ck6TUVMdydUryGjqw.text: I'm afraid I just don't understand the hype of Mi Patio. The restaurant has plenty of parking and it has a good location. It's clean and the decor is really bright and fun. The staff is friendly enough, but I didn't like the food.  I didn't really care for the salsa. It was fresh, but it had a muddled flavor of old cilantro that I didn't like. Also, the chips were stale.  Our food came out quickly, but I was pretty underwhelmed. I had the beef enchiladas with green sauce. The rice and beans had a burnt flavor; it's hard to describe, but I didn't like it. The meat did not taste fresh, and I couldn't see or taste the green sauce. Personally (and I know I'm in the minority here), I thought there was way too much cheese on the plate. I like cheese, but I don't want so much that it makes the food greasy. My husband had beef tacos with rice and beans. He liked the rice, but he felt that the beef wasn't fresh. He didn't finish his plate.  The prices were pretty cheap, but I feel like the food and experience was overhyped. I don't think I'll be back.

D2iVJH6jDZ7erXmigj1jyA.text: They have been around since 1984, so you know the must be doing something right.  Went there with a group of about a dozen coworkers for lunch.  Owner greeted us with smiles and treated us like we were the only people in the joint.  Food came out fast and drinks remained filled.  I got a chicken enchilada and it was excellent.  I should preface this by saying when it comes to Mexican food, it would have to be pretty lousy for me not to like it.  Chips and salsa provided and were decent.  Cool decor and very unique environment.  Overall, I would recommend this one if you are in the area.  My boss is very active with Yelp reviews and is a little more high maintenance than me, so I will be interested to see what she rates it.    At any rate, I wouldn't have any hesitation going back.

CX93mPx-_tRjyt1k4J0PQw.text: Me gusta Mi Patio! I had the chicken chimichanga and it was fantastic. I didn't know what to expect because I never had a chimi before but as soon as the delectable delight landed on the table I knew that I was in for a treat!  One suggestion I have for the owners is that they should make a contest for guests to try to guess how many bird placards and statues that they have in their restaurant. Seriously, if you visit take a look around...they're everywhere lol.

5MykHKO8S8-iTUKpZ_aRBA.text: I was excited to try this place after reading all the Yelp reviews, but I was extremely disappointed with this meal. It was just not good food. We had a big group and ordered a bunch of different items from the menu, including the tacos, burritos, appetizer supreme (DO NOT ORDER THIS it's really gross and gave me a stomach ache - basically just low quality beef and a ton of cheese mixed together on a platter...), and a taco salad. Everything was way too salty, smothered in cheese and grease, and nothing seemed fresh. I do not recommend this place! Not even because it's not "authentic" Mexican food; it just doesn't taste good. (Although maybe the food tastes better after a few $2 margaritas?)

OTeAgIBd_Dj-xEWG06RU7g.text: I'm kind of stunned by all of the really high ratings. I mean, it's not terrible - but it is also not stellar.   The best part was probably the chips and salsa.   I had the salad with steak. It was good and filling, but could have used a lot of salsa. And the amount of sour cream they threw on there was obscene. I didn't eat 3/4 of it, and it still felt smothered!!!  If you were craving some interesting combos, I'm sure the greek/mexican combos would be decent.   Overall, decent. Not something to write home about!

UAl8dUKSLyX0SMdm19CJoA.text: What does 5 stars really mean?  To me, it is based on the individual restaurant providing great food, over-the-top-service, ambiance, cleanliness, fair prices and portions for the TYPE of restaurant that it is.  I feel that some people here are missing the boat with their reviews, as they will RAVE about the restaurant, food and service, but then only give it 3 stars!  How completely unfair!   So, in my reviews, this means that I could give a FANTASTIC McDonald's a 5 star rating if they DESERVED it, but I wouldn't give them 2 stars because of comparing them to a gourmet burger shop!  They are who they are, and if they do it well, they deserve the best praise.  With this thought in mind, ANY restaurant, no matter how simple or elaborate, has the same fair opportunity to earn 5 stars from me, if they deserved it.  If you understand what I'm saying then here goes my review....  Mi Patio is a mid to low price point Mexican restaurant.  Most things on dinner menu were around $7.00 - $8.00.  The atmosphere is simple and not intended for a "night out on the town".    My ex-husband and I went there tonight.  We had two large entrees, two large size margaritas and the bill was $5.00 after our $20.00 Groupon was applied. The service was top-notch, fast and efficient.  Our waiter explained the specials in a way that enticed me to order one.  The bus-boy refilled our salsa and chips at the perfect moment without being asked.  Our food was served hot and in large portions.  In the middle of the meal, our waiter presented us with two shot glasses full of a "surprise" on-the-house-special drink that was very tasty.  When we approached the register to pay after the meal, the gentleman was very friendly about taking our Groupon and he had a genuine spirit of appreciation for us coming into the restaurant, leading me to believe he may have been the owner.    Although this was not a 5-star meal, this place certainly DESERVES 5 stars.

ow49oODhAd1HiYG7_RIUug.text: The salsa and food was amazing. It was very flavorful. It's one of the few restaurants that i've gone to several times (moved to Phoenix recently). I grew up with my parents cooking amazing food, so it's nice to find a place that has chicken that is juicy and has flavor. Many places have big pieces of chicken in their burritos that are just dry.  Highly recommend this restaurant.

SU3b1MH4DHW-qPsFyEIWwQ.text: Mi Patio is our favorite restaurant.  Not just our favorite Mexican restaurant...our favorite restaurant, period.  I love the Greek influence since most "traditional" Mexican restaurants in phoenix look at me funny when I ask for vegetables.    The servers are always fast and friendly.  the owner and managers talk with us like we've been friends our entire lives even though they may not even recognize that we are regulars.  we eat at mi patio for dinner, lunch and get lunch takeout.  it is always exactly what we were hoping for.    if you enjoy hot sauce we've discovered that they make a spicy sauce using Frank's red hot but you have to ask for it.  we ask for the diablo sauce since that is what they use for the diablo shrimp dish.  mi patio is great for vegans too.  they don't cook anything with lard and give you the opportunity to order anything without the cheese, without looking at you like your crazy.  Ive enjoyed the vegetable enchiladas (Mushroom, Zucchini, Egg Plant) without cheese and didn't feel like i was missing out on flavor.  their chips and salsa are my favorite in all of phoenix and they give you plenty with your food whether its to stay or to go.    kids are always treated with respect and they have tons of tolerance for our occasionally screaming 1 year old.  the kids meals have huge portions that make for great left overs and ice cream when theyre done!  our 5 year old asks to eat at mi patio at least twice a week.  we LOVE the margaritas!  there's nothing fancy about them but who needs fancy when you get to pay 2 or 3 bucks for a big ass margarita!?   don't let the outside of the building trick you into thinking its just a sleazy Mexican bar.  the beer banners totally turned me off before my husband made me try it for the first time.  just walk inside and enjoy the best of Phoenician Mexican food!

t39So1_EM7ZhTwgDfsxtmg.text: We were in Phoenix last week for vacation and business.  We were staying at an Airbnb close by.  When we went to the Safeway store across the street we could see that this restaurant was packed every time we went by.  So the last night we were there we checked it out.  The first person we met was a woman who had driven in from Flagstaff (over two hours away) and headed straight to Mi Patio!  She raved about the food.  I have to agree...the food was delicious!  I had the spinach enchilada with a delicious white cheese sauce with a cilantro pesto.  The beans and rice were terrific.  I drank the ice tea and it was also really good.  Love the food and the waiting service was also terrific.  All I can say...it may be the best Mexican food I've ever eaten outside of Texas!  You all are lucky!  Wish I lived closer!

5HhO98S8_xDBQ4dGRFhcaw.text: Delicious!   Chips and salsa were tasty and refilled.   Had a corn tamale and veggie enchilada.   Both were excellent.  Rice and beans very good.

79gjn8lEYctqlb3vpYu2oQ.text: This place is the best. Fast, amazing service; every single person here is keeping an eye on your water, your chips, your salsa-- seriously, INSTANT refills. Prices are unbelievably reasonable. $2.50 margs every day but do yourself a favor and get a premium "Cadillac" margarita. Just a super low-key, homey atmosphere, decent food (what you would expect-- quick, stick-to-your-ribs Mexican that they know how to do well), great place to just go and hang out, lunch or dinner. You can see why this place has been open for so long.

asfbb89km5T5tBsuIZblHw.text: I am going to have to say, I just do not know what all the fuss is about with this place. I have been here a few times or more over many years. The service is good however, The food is just not that fabulous! I think that they think if they get people to drink a lot,with their cheap Margaritas they will not notice the bland tatse.  I have given it many trys but, I just cannot do better than a 3 star for them.  They are a good location right on the corner, and they always seem to be busy.  They have been there for as long as I can remember as well. Just not loving the food here.

AAfwU8bHPky2gc4EYu7PeA.text: I always have amazing service and delicious food here! Definitely recommend. I love their salsa and spinach feta chimi.

_bwo7NnBKjF4qLUbiizsSA.text: My wife and I are from out of the area and on two separate occasions while driving by had noticed the parking lot busy each time so we took a chance. We weren't disappointed! Excellent food! Not the best Mexican food I've ever had but in the top 3. It was authentic, like homemade. (Almost) Excellent Chile Relleno and Shredded Beef Tacos. Great Chips and Salsa. Good service. Will definitely go back.

-uUyLeljA22NGfostbMrQQ.text: Cute little spot ok for a beer a drink or a quick snack. however it is the worst Mexican food I've ever had in my life. and the prices are ridiculous. I wanted to like it and have tried it 2 times hoping my first visit was a fluke. but it wasn't the food was just as terrible both times. I was with five other people and it wasn't just me nobody like their food. . The cheese crisp is ok but its cheese and tortilla. and it's way too expensive.  I work across the street and it would be a super convenient place for me to eat Mexican food but that ain't happenin.

w42Ulgu_HG6OswrxHm8_NQ.text: Wow! I'll keep it simple. This small homey Mexican restaurant has the best service I have ever experienced. The best mexican food ever! Everything is made from scratch, the flavors burst in your mouth and everything comes out piping hot! Order the Baja chicken burrito or the patio chimi! The salsa is amazing, ask for the hot stuff....so good!  Order the maragarita or ice cold can of tecate! Oh and every time I have been out waiter brings us a complimentary shot from the bar!  Take your friends and family here, you'll never go anywhere else.

gQH6-3aRqkmYdWzZy7k1yQ.text: We've been looking for a new Mexican restaurant for a few months now.  This is the 3rd one we've stopped at...  Atmosphere is ok...and facility is clean.  Servers are attentive with one exception....When I ordered a green burro with green sauce and the waiter giggled I should have taken the clue. I wish he'd had said no green sauce only cheese sauce.    Anyway, meat in taco unseasoned and cold.  Meat in tacos and was shredded and fat/grizzle free.  Plenty of lettuce and cheese  Burro was ok...sparse meat....and sweet tasting.  Like sweet peppers.  Wife's cheese enchilada was good...she had no complaints and her taco was warm.  Plenty of parking.

V85CrIVEb0rUWzjWylvJxA.text: Fantastic service here. Good taquitos aka flauntas. Chips and salsa were great. Carne Asada burro was pretty greasy. But, we will back.

gpxJpKRxBkzucrp9xFufCw.text: First time visitor, went during lunch time and it was super packed, but luckily we reserved a table ahead of time. It's probably not needed, but I recommend if you have more than 4 people.   The service was incredibly fast and it looks like a lot of people from local offices frequent this place because of the fast service.  The food was delicious and very filling! I will definitely be back.

em_lrpcP7I5Xi9cIs869jw.text: This place is great a must try for Mexican food. Quick service: fast refills especially with chips and salsa. I liked that I got my own salsa and didn't have to share haha! The vibe is nice it seems to be a family owned and operated. Which we should support small businesses :) I ordered the Chile rellano with rice and beans. The entree was good but rice was slightly dry. And I found a small black hair on the side of my plate. Cooks should be more careful. And that is why 4 stores. But other then those 2 things it was good. They should focus on more cleanliness.

uaTlhqbmqtFUAAZrOwOoXA.text: We came here with a coupon and it worked because now we pay full price we love it so much. This isn't close to my house, the other customers are irritating, Starbucks across the street is just stupid and I got fired from Safeway just a few feet away so it must be the food. I started coming here when I went to PC a thousand years ago. Classmates & I would hog a table while conspiring to cheat on our exams. The money we'd save would be a nice little bribe for the professors and for the hacker that would ultimately get us the grades we so rightly bought. This is a great hideout, especially mid summer because  it's nice and cold and dark and the tracking device the family put on me tells my wife's phone that I'm at Sprouts across the street. Rice, beans ... yadda yadda. good food. No pictures because I'm not 10 or trying to get youtube famous. Just try it here, but not when I'm here because you're probably going to take pix of your plate and you're irritating.

8krz79mvU3KLMOdinmaFBw.text: Everything about this place was amazing. The restaurant is a little small, but we were able to be seated pretty quickly. The food and service was A+! Some of the best Mexican food I've tried in Phoenix. At or table, we got the Mexican pizza, shrimp fajita, beef tacos, beef chimichanga, and a cheese enchilada. Everyone loved what they ordered. The chips and salsa were so addicting I almost wish they had stopped refilling everything so quickly because I couldn't stop eating them!!

DBtCUuSi8JyayGTHJLCqMQ.text: Great service,  great food.  Stopped in while in town visiting my girl Double Dee. I ordered a combo taco and enchilada and DD ordered floutas.

Q7-wa1_BsxIu3uQBadBBmA.text: The first time ever I came, I'm glad I did not write a review I had a HORRIBLE TIME/experience. The second visit was amazing I came alone and the ambiance was delightful and colorful, the food was

Fc6caSoWWzhWVbrUQ5WS1g.text: 6 of us went here. I had been once before at lunch and was not impressed but don't know what I ordered that time. I would have rated it 3 stars based on my experience but this time, I had an amazing experience and am increasing my rating.  We made reservations for a Sunday lunch. They had everything ready before we showed up and 6 bowls of chips and salsa on the table already. That made a huge impression. We were hungry and didn't have to wait. Can you believe one bowl and salsa for each person?! Awesome. Salsa was good.   This time I ordered a Baja sauce vegetarian chimichanga. It was delicious. I took leftovers home.   Others ordered Baja sauce burritos and a taco bowl.  They enjoyed their food as well.   A variety of margaritas were ordered. They weren't strong and you could enjoy the flavor.   What was weird was that their red and green enchilada sauces were not vegetarian! Glad we asked and didn't assume. That's why everyone had Baja sauce.  Summary: Portions were big, taste was good, service was good. We will be back.

1biFPn6-uaKDbAwbxPWwPg.text: My son and I went here Saturday for lunch. We were seated right away and with in seconds we had yummy chips and salsa. Our waiter was very good and our food came quick and hot! It was yummy! I definately will be coming back!!

24k-oZroq4pmdCGdfaUfAg.text: Really like this little place! Great tacos! Machaca chimichanga very good.  $1.99 margaritas!!! Chips and salsa are amazing!!! Chips were fresh and crispy.  Great service.  Neat atmosphere.  We will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Mi Patio - Phoenix, AZ, United States

e3s2wNgRT7FrfyWuz8QAjg.text: Now that's a taco salad!  Every forkfull came away with perfectly seasoned fajita chicken on it.  Nachos Supreme in the background with the most tender melt in your mouth green chilli beef and all the fixins! Plus all the fresh made salsa and chips (so good when they bring them to you hot) that you can eat.  We found this little restaurant when we first came to Phoenix and between consistent delicious food and always friendly service they won our hearts and stomachs.

2v9_8mXP698-nk20Ky8qTQ.text: I love good mexican food. This is one of my favorite place. Atmospear is nice. Servers are great and attend to your request. If you like green chili ..this is the place to go.

TK8W6Qmb2VQCXux3GVNahg.text: When the cook is terrible, the cook adds excessive salt on the food. Avoid this place.

yZiQ788r04gbvQaEhUp54A.text: Wow! We were visiting from California and got this to go, it's one of the best Mexican restaurants that we have had! The tacos, salsa, beans, rice, and horchata were so flavorful and amazing! The enchiladas and tortillas were so authentic! Wish there was one of these out in Cali!

5yhe-48im3FFNuE0Co-7qQ.text: Skip the 2.50 margarita special that likely brought you there to begin with. But on round two of drinks, expect them to give you a free shot that has a kick. The service is awesome- reminiscent of those don't-hassle-me waitresses from 50s diners. Love it. The fajita plate doesn't come sizzling on a skillet, but the meat is well seasoned and the portion was enough to split with my boyfriend (after devouring two bowls of chips for an app). The chicken burrito is a must. Ask for a cold mug with any bottled beer. The icy mug is ideal for this summer scorch!

qLl20BmaA5Q5Ux2SqJGK0w.text: We arrived in Phoenix not too hungry after a big lunch, but couldn't resist a good Mexican meal.  Extremely happy to find Mi Patio and enjoy drinks with their beef burro and shrimp enchiladas!  We loved the chips and guacamole too.  Their friendly hostess and server made us feel welcome and happily deciphered a couple authentic menu items.  We will be back!

8PMaIHfhACYEY1K9IstoOA.text: Food is always amazing.  The service was very good. Very friendly and very very quick .  We started off with the mini chimi's which came out AMAZING. Comes with 8 of them.   I had a Verde Chicken Enchilada , comes with frijoles, and rice smothered in cheese.  My bf got the Giant Carne Asada plate with frijoles, rice, beans, and Pico de gallo it was SOOO good.   They gave us complimentary shots and also Gabe us the Best service . This is a must go to place. Arrive early it gets packed fast and the parking may be tight.

3aiyxaEGAurk_LL4Z4UTQw.text: We are in Phoenix for some spring training games. Of course we want to have some Mexican food while we are here.   I found Mi Patio and boy am I glad I did. From getting there and being seated right away to friendly and efficient service it we a great dinner. I had the fish flauta- it has an amazing cilantro pesto. The other people in my party had fajitas and the veggie enchilada. All were excellent as were the margaritas. Friendly service, great prices, and delicious food. Best meal of our trip.

V97vz7XuX3UyYFLnKCNg1Q.text: Oh yeah, this place rocks. It's been an institution of Mexican food for many years. My GF ordered the Spinach Enchiladas and she loved them. They do load these things up with the cheese. I ordered the Chimichanga and it was a lot better than Carolinas. Highly recommended.

Qra822l7EcXH9VRwoj5nTA.text: Completely Underwhelming. Checked this local restaurant on Yelp. The reviews were great so I figured I would give it a shot. The horchata was pretty good. The chips pretty bad, the salsa was okay. I ordered the Chicken Chimichanga. It wasn't bad, but all the water in the chicken was pretty gross. My whole plate is soaked in chicken water. The service is passable. I have to wonder why they have received so many favorable reviews. I think it's because its cheap. There is nothing special here.

La7Q2IiMy0hww3GAQW1YvQ.text: Amazing service. Amazing food! I call the service here right down home hospitality! Greeted with a smile, made to feel like you are special, they got the customer service recipe down! I had chicken and cheese enchilada - and oh my (!) - they were delicious! I can't find a single thing wrong with this place. Came on a weekday afternoon for lunch - plenty of parking. Had a couple of their $2.49 margaritas (special runs all day everyday I am told) and they too were spot on! Highly recommend this place - you can't go wrong!

mJJLKfYfDrpu8mX_vK7MGw.text: The service was fast  and friendly, The atmosphere is absolutely wonderful,  and the food is fresh and authentic! Their happy hour deals are an added bonus. I highly recommend it for any occasion.

0Oub-Xa8Fm9ixjoon26yEA.text: This place is a good place to go when you're in a hurry to scratch that itch for your Mexican fix. It's service with a smile and in a hurry. The prices are good, the menu is simple, and the margaritas... well... they have specials all day. I only wish I didn't have to drive back to work so I could enjoy a few.  I've been coming here for quite a while. Decent food, fast service, even in rush hour.

8nXD8bpuRWAoPVK3LR4v1w.text: Not authentic shrimp ala diabla but spicy enough on a slow day the waiter was not to friendly he was too bus y with the baseball game.

mbxiuT4knDIHhW7MIgR10Q.text: The Margaretta's were weak and after 4 didnt even have a buzz. The baja Buro tasted like they opened a can of cream of chicken and poured it on top. There was nothing baja about it. The customer service was horrible!

OyQqIAKyKk480Pm9uC3afA.text: First time here!  What a great spot. Real family owned place. Food was very well prepared, waiter was super attentive and the drinks were great!  Would definitely recommend for a casual dinner out.

R1z-DNtw-XD8Tv1p7-AyOA.text: My daughter and I went in for some late dinner. Our hotel concierge said it was a great little mom and pop Mexican joint with good food.   Well, I have to agree. The service was fantastic and they couldn't have been more welcoming. Our food was very good traditional Mexican. I had the green enchiladas with chicken and my daughter had cheese enchiladas. Both were great. The chips and salsa were fantastic.   A great family place. Oh, a really good margarita too!  Matty approved.   PS- told some friends about it and they went the next night and had exactly the same experience.

7Dk6Rumh-RXzp2RDm2P4lw.text: Not a positive experience for us. We were seated promptly, but it took 25 minutes for the waitress to take our order. I ordered a margarita and it arrived AFTER our food. My food order was incorrect and had to be sent back, adding 20 additional minutes to our visit. My friend ordered a green tamale, which was basically corn mush smothered in green chile. The staff is friendly,  but the service is unusually slow and the food leaves a lot to be desired. Disappointing.

fHGUBIK1wojv4Gq25wF3_w.text: Food did not taste the same for this last visit, somehow it was a lot more greasy and a bit salty and way too much cheese. Tried #100 on the menu - Should have tried the burritos (next time).The margaritas was definitely not as good/strong/tasty as I remembered as previously. Staff was nice and friendly (still a good thing). A large birthday group with friends. A private room in the back was a nice. It's always a fun place to go, if you are in the mood for margaritas and Mexican food. Will give this another try sometime soon.

Chi0m2FGblkQkqcrOQxzdw.text: Well, that was fun! The husband and I couldn't pass up the chance to check out a $1.99 margarita. We should have. It was reminiscent of lemon-lime Gatorade and theraflu. So what was so fun, you ask? The super sweet greeting by every person we walked in to, the great service from a guy wearing awesome pleather pants and a Gucci belt, the good food (Baja burro, yeah! Fish tacos, nahh!), the birds hanging basically every 1.5 feet throughout the joint & how could I leave out the complimentary Mexican kamikaze! It was probably the nastiness shot of my life but there was no way I was leaving it on the table when no one else in the place received one. We will be back, likely with hidden mini-shots for our margs, but we'll be back.

hUc6EnyzTO3SKPZ3Z-WW6w.text: Overpriced and overrated! I could have saved my $11, which $3 of it was for the side of sour cream and guacamole. The guacamole taste like the seasoning mix from the grocery store and the salsa is weak! My tacos were nothing to brag about either. I guess there food taste better when you have some margaritas! So disappointed!

cl31Of5urMzMHRn0PaFvgg.text: This place was awesome! The chips were never empty and a great price on the drinks and food. Our waiter was super helpful and attentive and will definitely be back when in the Phoenix area!

bHrTbEstbcPQM2_69A72MA.text: This is the worst Mexican food I've had in my life. The salsa was nasty, tortilla was tough like they just threw it in the microwave, and it's pretty expensive.

pAI4DsKxsl4aEkaZLfL2vw.text: Love the shredded beef tacos!  I haven't eaten in the restaurant yet only take out. Their take out deals are fantastic. Great food and super affordable.

Dfud7QAzQoTrKvWcbwVFwQ.text: Excellent food, bomb free salsa and chips (seriously, the salsa is awesome), what more do you want? A bigger location and more seating would be nice, but if you want quality Mexican food and a good price, you've got it at Mi Patio.

t5dYB9PTIPKvCFDQaj_Wog.text: Came here today. Service has improved immensely. Food is still so so. I like this place. Very relaxing environment. 7 or of 10 would recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Mi Patio - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Great salsa. Quesadilla is good. Love DOS EQUIS.

3lQTYzHYGhGIUPbWM9eGyA.text: This place caught my eye with the $1.99 Margaritas. We stopped here and grabbed lunch. The salsa they brought out was delicious. My niece ordered the enchiladas with white sauce (consisted of cream cheese) and it was amazing!!! If you stop here try it for sure. Great staff, refilled our chips with hot fresh chips,  made sure our drinks were full, and the atmosphere is so chill. Great place!!! Wish I lived closer, I would be here all the time!

OF9t4qP8gge6f15aAlGGUQ.text: Not authentic, overpriced Mexican food that would wow ppl not familiar with real Mexican cuisine but most foods lack flavor and overpriced have been here a few times and but my most recent visit a man who appeared to be the owner/manager was our server for the day and was rude, didn't answer our questions and made it clear he did not care about our experience there. My family and friends clearly noticed it too even the man refilling our salsas noticed it and said he apologized for his boss not checking on us more. Would stay away from this place as it rips off the name of Mexican food and culture and uses it to trick those who don't know any better into spending their money there (also worst tacos in the state of Arizona)

wmBPX_x6rokqtNW0xHEswg.text: The service is really good at this restaurant. The food was average for Mexican food, but felt more like a fast food place. Overall it's a very nice place for $. Would not recommend it for someone that likes authentic Mexican.

g3s8E5ihwTAwfj0UUFAJ3g.text: Never say never! In my previous post I stated I would not come back to Mi Patio. Well I did. I went with my friends for lunch.. It was pretty packed. I had their cheese crisps and another order of their beans, rice, enchilada and chicken tacos. I was hungry when I came so I think I would have loved anything. Food is okay, not the authentic Mexican food you would have at a food truck.

1wPrU21TdvvTbB3upxZPlA.text: What a great little place we stumbled upon. Hungry from a long flight from Ohio we were desperate to find a sit-down non-chain lunch spot. We passed this place and the lot was full at 11:30 am so we figured it must be good. We were seated right away and the wait staff was on top of it, refilling drinks, chips, and salsa without having to ask. Upon the recommendation of our server I got the deep fried burrito with cream sauce and it was delicious. My co-worker got the Greek/Mexican salad with gyro meat and said it was good as well. Also the homemade chips and salsa were on point. Food was delivered very quickly so this would be a great choice is you are in a hurry.

-NgvUTdc0_lae2WoXW4U1w.text: Best Mexican restaurant in the neighborhood! The service is great, our server especially was quirky and entertaining! We ordered a pitcher of margaritas and tacos and everything came out quick and tasted great. I will definitely be coming back here more. Thanks for being awesome!

a9CUfR6b5Out2kPGtvrShw.text: Si!  My old stand-by phrase is, "A lot of places serve good Mexican food."  It's True--there are tons of places that will serve up a burrito or rellenos nice and neat, no problem.  And then, there's Mi Patio.  Do you ever get that feeling at the end of a meal where you are completely full but the food tasted so good that you want to continue eating?  That's how I felt here.  These were some of the best enchiladas I have ever tasted.  The rice was authentic, and I ate every speck of the beans.  I often don't finish the beans when I eat at a Mexican joint because they usually taste. . .blah.  No blah here--just REALLY good.  Distinct salsa flavor--more chips please!  My new favorite for Mexifood in the Valley.  There's good places closer to me, but for great, I'll travel a few extra miles to come here.

pzeCM2Ii9hKRGySuZ7-wJw.text: That. salsa. though.... Tasty cheese enchilada / bean tostada combination, $1.99 margarita... all delicious, but I was ready to smuggle that salsa back to Brooklyn. They'll sell it to you, too. In Styrofoam cups. Or your own container if you bring one. Absolute flavorful perfection. (No heat. All tasty.)

zLALzHQhp14f5LdzT9nZ4Q.text: We were seated immediately, and drink orders taken. To start, the chips were warm and the salsa wasn't too spicy. Enchiladas were extra cheesy, the hard shell shredded beef tacos were seasoned just right and the rice was very good. You can usually judge how good a Mexican food place is going to be based on the chips and salsa and Mi Patio did not disappoint !! Great service and kept the chips and salsa coming. Will definitely be back next time we are in Phoenix.

HJ66ybL7kNhQGu6equ-e-A.text: This is actually the only Mexican place I have been to in Phoenix. Partly because I love this place so much I wouldn't want to find another place. Partly because I fear I won't find another good place I like.   My BF introduced me to this place (as he introduced me to everything in Phoenix) him and co workers would come here sometimes. It is very good. I have no complaints. I love the setting, the food and the good service! I swear the drink/chip server comes along SO often! He is on top of it ALL the time! Never had a problem with service... one time salt was actually in my margarita (which is weird because I brought a friend here and the same thing happen to her so I'm not sure if they make them like that) but it was fixed pronto.   The food is good, I am very confident in trying different things on their menu because I have never had anything bad. This is VERY RARE for me. I usually get the same thing when I go to a place more than once.   I lived in San Antonio for several years so I know good Mexican food, and this place is pretty comparable. :)

photos.caption: Photo of Mi Patio - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Yes Hunty! I never leave here unsatisfied!

EH6WVHYq_BrPnbol5zW26w.text: Amazing food for a reasonable price! We started off with their everyday $2.50 margarita(yum) then I built my own burrito. It came on a huge plate and I could only finish half. They waiter was very friendly and made sure each of us had enough salsa and chips at all times ! :) I will for sure be back!

Ad_7ps5dWLZJ05kqGFsO7g.text: Small little hole in the wall type restaurant, but those are often the best places to eat! The atmosphere was vibrant and inviting, staff were very friendly from the moment we walked in and had a family-run vibe. Despite the completely full little parking lot there were several open tables so we were seated right away and boy is their service fast here! Served right away with some delicious chips and salsa to start. I wish I could have ordered a big batch of salsa to take home that night because it was that good. And our food came out so fast! I ended up ordering the $15 Carne Asada meal and it was probably the best carne asada I've had in a long time. Meat was tender, cooked and cut perfectly. The rice, beans and other included add-ons were also very good and plentiful. I just wish this place was a closer drive for us because I would definitely come back here often and it's a must try for any Mexican food lovers.

qhGXZWkiAJ3fKRx3Q3T9Tw.text: So I should've of know not to trust the reviews when they were mostly written by Caucasians (no offense) but their Mexican food knowledge usually not the same as ours  I gave it 3 starts only because the service was by far one of the best I've ever had everyone super friendly and very attentive loved it.   The food was not at all what I expected portions were good but lacked the authentic Mexican food flavor.     We would only come back for  the customer service

vb7VE_7_ERIyg9BAsLTCXg.text: First time here today & I will be back!  Greeted by Leslie - behind the bar, the owner & some of the staff.  Beautiful inside, clean & very friendly atmosphere!  Food was excellent, including green corn tamales, black beans, homemade salsa..excellent service!  So glad I stopped!! Portions are huge ... may bueno!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Mi Patio - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Green corn meatless tamales filled with spinach...

11vr50hCeF69-rACq1xEIg.text: Soil classic ameri Mexican sit down food, with a few good and quite veggie options.  The chips and salsa are quite standard and decent, The veggie enchiladas with mushrooms, zucchini and more are also great, large full of well sauteed veggies in a flaful sauce and smothered in the obligatory cheese.   The real key to the rating here was the speed, at lunch one does not have the time to wait 20 min for food and 10 min to order. Here you can order with in a few min of sitting down munch of 10 chips and 6 min later your hot food will arrive.  This makes it a great place for a lunch meetup.   There is plenty of seating but not much parking so carpool if possible

pJVT_dsiT1KBbitUZcl03A.text: Got the shredded chicken enchiladas. Sooooo amazing. I fell in love. Super nice and quick service. Will def be coming back very often. Also gave me a bag of some delicious chips and salsa.

QspWOFlISL1D_1W_EvR9sA.text: East coast man meets west coast Mexican restaurant. For this to have been my 1st mexican restaurant to try in PHX, I was highly disappointed. I wasn't a high fan of the house salsa. I ordered the steak quesadillas and I wish I hadn't. They were extremely greasy and didn't have any flavor. I ordered a house margarita as well, more like a house lemonade.

5s5y9RB_SkUSgyNtNHyCPw.text: the place is cute & very Mexican theme, made me feel right at home. this is probably the closest ill get to (good) authentic Mexican food & their wide selection of beer. the servers & bussers are the nicest too, those men know their customer service. even got a complimentary margarita shot ;) + complimentary chips & salsa. loved it! we be returning

cro-xZAIEw2z7hKsBgJsFQ.text: Whenever a Mexican restaurant serves meals on reusable plastic plates, I'm already a fan.  Margaritas are cheap and weak. The service is surly. The food isn't healthy.  But if you want guilty Mexican fare (mini chimis, gobs of cheese, huge burritos) for under $10, get over here.

s4T8wh6rMckjr63Y8LQzvA.text: This place is a gem. Clearly Phoenix has no shortage of good Mexican food but this place is beyond what I've had other then my Spanish friends moms cooking. Everything is amazing and the staff is so friendly. I wish I was in the area to eat here more often.

mfTe-xc1tHAW4AFSoaQocg.text: Red chili was really good, salsa was great, price was fair and the staff very friendly. Will be back to try something else.

C3SDBjvWiGLJPr6dR5-KUg.text: Good food for the price! Reasonable, friendly. Very attentive sala and chips are good , homemade salsa, burritos and guacamole are taste!

photos.caption: Photo of Mi Patio - Phoenix, AZ, United States. God atmosphere!

-BbMB5WkUyJR4rf8hrj-1Q.text: I've been here a number of times & the food is always great & the margaritas a bargain. Tonight I pulled a rookie move and went out @7 on a Friday. Place was very busy. Manager George was friendly, honest about the wait time, and very hands on. He did a great job. We were seated ahead of the quoted time, and the food was great and the margaritas a bargain. This place is a well run joint. Not to be missed.

W1g-WZYxMXZheS1AK4Mdlw.text: Good hot food! Very friendly service! Very cute clean restaurant. Nice place to relax to have a meal or cocktail.

ey3ufg4FLJ0AQLYMYCOtoA.text: Mi Patio is a long time fixture in central Phoenix Mexican food. The family that runs it is part Greek, I understand. That is why they have such yummy menu items as the gyro burro (photos). And that is not beans that came with it, but a squash salad in red sauce. The burro is topped with a yogurt cucumber sauce and was delicious.

39WpgO8MVW0zXIUBEgIv2Q.text: Tastes like a TV dinner. Burrito was filled with overcooked chicken and tons of bell peppers. Steak burrito was flavorless, and the cheese just added a gross texture. The rice tasted like a bad premade seasoning, and the beans were bland and again, the cheese added nothing. Two burritos, rice, and beans came out to almost $30. Overpriced, terrible food.

5sW44NZCWs11ISloIY6b-A.text: I came here for lunch during the week with coworkers. I had chicken fajita with a salad instead of rice and beans. The plate of food was huge!! It had a lot of meat and less veggies, which I would have preferred the opposite, but it was still good. It wasn't overly greasy either (which is normally a problem with fajitas). A friend got a Mexican pizza that was also huge! She easily could have shared that with two others and I would recommend that- it was expensive. I payed $15 for my fajitas...  The service was good with very nice servers. The chips and salsa were continually refilled without having to ask- and at the rate I eat them... that's always a plus when they can keep up. I liked this place, but I wouldn't go again because the food was just normal, the location, and price.

VU7MxFlKxF6pT3SAHBOzPQ.text: Best place to go for lunch! Ask to have Tammy as your waitress, she is awesome! Been coming here for years!

Eftqh9hs1eG9IHz4rQk4bQ.text: Quick, cheap, delicious! If you want authentic dive Mexican food this is the place to take out of towners too! Salsa is delish too!

eoYyvxgJJK2nxui8KOyXOQ.text: Wish we had 1/2 ratings as I would give a definite 4 1/2 to Mi Patio. Stopped by the other day on a whim and a desire for some Mexican food. I was not disappointed. Small place, nice decor, nothing fancy, but had a great feel.  Friendly staff and before I knew it, I had some chips (seemed fresh) and salsa...my favorite, sometimes I could just sit and munch and forget about anything else. But, I was on a mission...to eat. Checked the menu, everything was there. I chose the Chimi with beef.  For me, this was the right choice, I was great and there was not a morsel left on the plate. The beef was especially good with a good texture and seasoned just right. All of the ingredients seemed fresh and blended well.  I am not familiar with the restaurant as it is quite a drive from my home, but if it were closer, it would be on my regular list as there are several menu items I would like to try. I am sure Mi Patio has a steady following of satisfied customers. I am a fan

Wf32fZqRK-rFsqCeL-02ag.text: Love Mi Patio !   I have never had a bad meal there. There is a wide selection of daily specials and standards on the menu. Love the light crispy chips and killer salsa. The service was friendly and the food came out hot and delicious. We will be back for sure !

sQySiRiYuEBxSNEhnz-B8Q.text: The lady bartender displays the most blatant display of poor customer service. We were sat at the bar as there was no other seating available at the moment Boy I wish we waited! . Literally this bartender is THEEE definition of rude. She was negative as soon as we were sat. Not even greeting us, naturally I initiated a hello & made casual conversation about how busy the place was & how much money is out there she replied abruptly and snarky with "well if these people decide to tip. It all depends on the people" I was taken a little a-back by the response but OK?? That set the tone for the rest of the visit. I wasn't served water, I had to ask. My license was thrown back at me, after requesting a margarita. I had to ask and was made to feel like a nuisance asking for water, chips, and salsa umm isn't this standard !?  You could imagine at this point I didn't want to order any food to accompany my margarita however, my friends had already ordered.  Without even asking she held up my friends orders ASSUMING I would order too.  I had to instruct her "I will not be ordering you need to put their food orders in." At this point the bartender ignored requests for water, said "sure" or "hold on" when asked for refills. If I had driven myself I would've let her have it and walked out but I had to keep my composure as my friends ordered food and I was with them. She slammed food and drinks down. I left a dollar tip because she poured my drink NOTHING ELSE. I did not order another drink & urged my friends to hurry up as I did not want to spend another minute being treated like I wasn't a paying customer !? This place gets 1 star cause the margarita was actually decent for a sweet price. The sour that came with it? I'll never be back.

kf10QIAr3b_iSN0EyBNBPw.text: I live walking distance from here and I wanted to love it. But it just isn't good...it's just not. The margaritas taste like water and the food is just flavorless. Even the salsa is just bland. I've tried a couple of times and it's just not worth it.

Qg-wvMfAwz_E92zkgQit7w.text: So this is my second time here so here it is: the chips and salsa sucked! Their spicy version tasted like a bottle of Tapatio, don't get me wrong I like Tapatio, but not on my chips. Rice was too salty! I ordered the Baja Chicken Burrito with the Baja sauce on top, which the chicken was tasty.  That is the reason im giving it a 2 otherwise it would be a 1.  My boyfriend got the Flautas and they were extremely crunchy with pretty much nothing inside, just crunchy tortilla!   I must say I was very disappointed for a Mexican place that is rated as a 4.5.   Last thing we got the "horchata' which is their rice drink and it isn't homemade it tasted nothing like cinnamon or sugar or even horchata. I was extremely disappointed.
