L82ebvrF4Cn5rhkh_Pd-QQ.text: I have been going to Mi Patio for 20-some years, so it holds a special place in my belly.    The salsa is some of the best around, but my secret trick is it mix it with some of their red hot sauce (you have to ask for it!) to give it that extra punch! I could eat their chips and salsas as a whole meal.  For being a more traditional Mexican joint, Mi Patio has fantastic vegetarian options (but beware of the rice!) and some quirky Greek food thrown in. The price to portion ratio is very fair and $9 will get me enough food for 2 meals. The service here is VERY quick - you can be and out in 45 minutes.

6kUziSXOMc_vI2-xHBDDyQ.text: Our son is great about suggesting restaurants for us to try. For the most part all have been great places, except for Mi Patio Mexican Restaurant. First of all, this place has too much going on therefore very noisy.   I ordered the #96 combo. Two beef tacos, rice and beans. The rice not only looked as old as the moon but tasted awful. The beans were tasteless as well. The shredded beef in the taco was so greasy....it dripped, needed to be cooked with some spices to help it taste like something.  My husband had the red chile burro, again, no flavor what so ever.  The complimentary chips and salsa were just as bad. The over powering of cilantro trying to cover up jared salsa??? The chips reminded me of store bought, not even served warm.  I didn't think it was possible to screw up Mexican food, how wrong am I!  Our waiter didn't bother to check on how we were doing once the food was served. Just as well, he would of gotten an earful. This place is for Gringos who don't know any better about authentic Mexican food. But.... if you like to drink Margaritas, then for $1.99 a glass you can have a few, get drunk and think the food was great!

bnCYGFpQcYnw5nqcXHE_Dw.text: Family owned, great staff, quick service, endless/delicious chips and salsa, cheap margaritas all makes for a favorite local Phoenix joint.   Love this place a ton and always make a stop when I am home from NYC. Fairly priced, a ton of food, and good ambiance. There are randomly a ton of fake birds all over the place and they put far too much cheese on everything, but this place is great.

9PbUQxt_b-UDfSuzpTmb0w.text: I went to Mi Patio the other night for the first time with the BF. The place is a cute little restaurant that is pretty unassuming from the outside. The salsa is spicy and fairly tasty. The service was attentive. I had the 'healthy' burro and it was very good...grilled fajita chicken and veggies. It also helped that I stole some guac from the BF's chimi...the guac added exactly what this burro needed. I would go back.

kc0kTziEAN5s2JkiV4GXTw.text: This is one of the best Mexican food restaurants I have been to! It always has fresh food and serve a never ending bowl of chips and salsa. I love coming here with my girlfriend and I usual get a burrito but she loves their enchiladas, they never let us down with that one. It's also a great atmosphere, it seems really small but in reality they make it pretty roomy!

9qJZpD17hbjZYqGh9mCLwA.text: Good food, good service and friendly people.  Not the tip-top, and not overly imaginative, but prices are good and it's great for lunch ... we go there regularly and are never disappointed

cIe4znaVKBxEOm9eCt8JbA.text: A downgrade in rating is needed here. I've eaten here several times since my initial review and while the service has remained very good, the quality of the food seems to have declined. The portions are still generous, but the rice is dry and the entrees are often not seasoned properly - they come out too salty or tasteless. And I wish the margaritas had some alcohol; if there's any, it's almost undetectable - so no wonder they are inexpensive. Service,  4 stars; food, 2 stars; so, 3 stars for the average ... and average is probably the best term to use for this place right now.

CIxqxjxHMPEWBBu_CvfzpA.text: I have lived down the street from this place for my entire life and I have never stepped inside until this week. I have been to a lot of the mexican food places in this area and this one by far is the best. I can literally drink the salsa at this place it is that good. The food itself is also incredible. If you have not tried this place I do not know what you are waiting for. Get in you car/bus/plane/bike and get over here asap. You won't regret it.

9t-1wBWix5X3mXYP2iz8lA.text: This place is terrible!! Service was very poor and ridulously slow!  Took forever to get any refills and the waitress lacked attention!! Fish flautas were very dry and bland and they actually forgot to put the sauce on the flautas after I finished my first one.  Noise level is absolutely terrible!! Would certainly not come back here any time soon!!

lQVMRemP5NlkhPKl8tvD9w.text: Great food, service and well priced.   The salsa is the best in town, hands down. We usually get the 'to go' special and it comes with chips and they always give me a little extra of their homemade salsa. We think they have the best tacos, too.  Dine in service is always great with prompt refills on chips and drinks before you have to ask.

HvHIEhBepR0HTHImT6AGdA.text: Last year I came to this place with coworkers and the food was not as everyone talked about.   All this craze that is was some really good authentic Mexican food.  Not True at all, all of the food is drenched in yellow cheese. You know if the service was great you sometimes over see a few things on the food but when food sucks and service sucks also then you have nothing to gain from coming to this place.  We came again this year (last week) and still the same shity service and wow the food!!!!!!! The food was gross. .... I asked for Chile Verde, hold on I asked the guy. Hey which one is better the green or red he said green. Should not of done that, food was nasty. One good thing was the beans... beans were good. Will not go again.

sUw2vzYVCcyO8RtdfW7DHw.text: This place is super delicious...food is always nice, hot and served quickly.  The Gyro Chimichanga is my absolute favorite. Plus the daytime latino waiter with the Gucci belt is super good to look at! lol Great wait staff and inexpensive!

PrQMv762-4XeMRFHfYM9cg.text: My son told us about this place and what a wonderful treat this was.  We live in Tucson but go to Phoenix quite frequently because our son lives there so we try new restaurants there as well.  This place has an unusual twist as it is certainly Mexican but with the Greek influence.  My first impression when we walked in was it seemed clean, warm and extremely friendly.  The service was super.  Three people and three bowls of chips and yummy salsa for each of us.  The chips were warm and obviously home made.  The menu is outstanding and interesting choices.  I had the carne asada which had  a hint of lemon and gave it the flavor of a gyro.  My hubby ordered Eggplant enchilladas and he loved it.  Good prices, great service, and best of all cheap Margaritas.  $1.75 all day any time. A little weak but that was OK.  I'll certainly return to try more of the offerings.

photos.caption: Photo of Mi Patio - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Enchilladas
Photo of Mi Patio - Phoenix, AZ, United States. That&#39;s us.

mMciSbrpVvqD7ZaipziuOQ.text: Love this place! Born and raised in AZ and the best Mexican food in the Valley! The beans are delish abc the service is great, Margarita are only $1.75 all day everyday   I get the chicken  flautas

1UaUh5cP5tRlPfQjEhU3nQ.text: Chips were stale, Sad Excuse for "cheese dip!!" The water even tasted dusty! I would HIGHLY recommend going somewhere else

Z1qT2qS3ZvsqStuqzSrdIQ.text: Like most Phoenicians, I love Mexican food! That being said, there are many places to choose from when you want to get a quick fix of chips, salsa and a margarita... But if you want delicious, quality food for a reasonable price, look no further than Mi Patio!  Located, literally, on the corner of 7th Avenue & Osborn this Mexican restaurant has great salsa, which I believe is very important to any chips & salsa lover. Whether you want a mild Pico de Gallo or a more spicy salsa, they have both!  My boyfriend & I dine here frequently. We both get two shredded beef tacos- They consistently have generous portions of beef, lettuce and cheese that will fill you right up. I always order mine with a side of guacamole and it is a perfect addition to my order.  Although some may argue that the decor is somewhat cheesy, I like it. The restaurant appears fun & that is exactly what I am looking for in a Mexican restaurant. Also, every staff member I have interacted with is extremely friendly & helpful! They are always attentive when it comes to refilling our chip bowl, salsa & drinks.  Overall, if you are looking for both, quality AND quantity Mexican food- Give Mi Patio a try! You will be glad you did!!

IzWMkWWMyQYpzsyVLNA10w.text: My favorite Mexican restaurant in Arizona and one of my top five favorite restaurants in general. Great prices, great staff, and amazing food. Need more locally owned places with this quality in Phoenix.

_C0DtgdqbijMV9ZsQF7q9Q.text: After reading reviews we thought we would give it a try and it was horrible. The bussers were more attentive than the server , asked her several times for a  side of chili never received anything. The worst I have had here in Phoenix.

erN6TOp8aFTVQbj-C-gFcQ.text: Mi Patio should be renamed the village restaurant. This is the place to see and be seen in Phoenix. Politicians, celebrities, and working poor people like me that want great food at a great price! You will not find a more efficient and tasty lunch experience in Phoenix. Thumbs up for the Mi Patio staff and service.

xcEeJ--jAszwGwEC8vlCyA.text: We went on a busy Sunday afternoon. Service was fine considering how busy it was. Chips were a little stale. Food was OK, but nothing we would come back for. We were hoping we would like it considering how close we live to it. It kind of reminds me of a place where gringos would get drunk and wouldn't mind how the food was.

Xp0mqEicl9IVzFHaKHuXvQ.text: Went here with my sis and cousin and friend, the service was excellent, we informed them that the margaritas tasted watered down and weak so they gave us fresh ones that tastes awesome and gave us complimentary shots. The food was excellent and I enjoyed the atmosphere for a tiny place, I'll be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Mi Patio - Phoenix, AZ, United States

wC3as1C1O60JO-RTPkFv8A.text: Spinach enchiladas with white source were terrific! The margarita was great! Not bad at all for the first time.

cpyCI6o6N7xJJYWTeNJYQA.text: This place had very good service and a nice casual atmosphere. The food was good, but I definitely prefer a couple other local Mexican restaurants. They filled the chips immediately if the were running low. The Margaritas were good and I would come back just for them and maybe a taco or cheese crisp.

Kt5BlQ6pCLVb3a2YS81LzA.text: One of the worst Mexican restaurants I've eaten in. Ordered the Chile relleno but the breading on pepper had to much egg added, forming an omelette-like chile relleno. Disgusting. Service was awful as well. Waited 10 minutes just to have drink orders taken. Will never enter this establishment again.

mDmaUS0NVLYTTTHIY_i7gg.text: The best Mexican food I've had in Arizona. Rice and beans must be homemade. I never rant about rice and beans..I had the cheese enchiladas and a chile relleno. Both were outstanding. Salsa was great too.  We had great service too. We drove by this place a bunch of times over the years. Kept saying "we should try that place". We are definitely going back. Also couldn't finish it all, so we both got 2 meals out of it. You should try this place..

ilfQ_jVFTnJoZCrFedKAEQ.text: I don't know what the customers are praising about growing up on Mexican food this was horrible service was horrible the waiter and the bus girl seemed pissed off and way overpriced never will be coming here again

5vkB7C2ZEYRz9JLAkyWooA.text: We came in to town for a jiu jitsu tournament. I wanted to book a table somewhere for our team who was competing and working the tournament. I called a few places and had a hard time booking our size of party. when i called Mi patio the were very accommodating and right next to our hotel. The food was good the drinks were good and the staff was very nice even with our huge crazy party. We will definitely make this our go to place for our yearly tournament.

oNDuJdfdlKaa-G2jxklDoA.text: Friendly and adorable decorations.  The wait staff was right on you and offered specials and chips and yummy salsa.  The food was delivered HOT and fresh and it was excellent.  What a great find.  Enjoy a great meal, friendly people and cute place.  Highly recommend it!!

d4K34eTOeZhXHdCaSUX2dA.text: I ordered takeout from here because of a Livingsocial deal. the online ordering process was really simple and easy. the food was a good value for the price (even without the deal). we ordered the carne asada plate and the chicken taco combo. it was a ton of food for two people! come here if you want tex-mex style food - meaning LOTS of cheese on their rice and beans, good guac, and great salsa

q4C0kL7sHNXNkBUgjigGFg.text: I have been back to Mi Patio several times since my first review.  I like it better every time I go.  I really enjoy the shredded beef tacos and margaritas.

photos.caption: Photo of Mi Patio - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Mi Patio - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Mi Patio - Phoenix, AZ, United States

uSRTyCYacFZzImDobt0D6w.text: Great place. Enjoyed the food, and the employees were very friendly and attentive.  I'll be back.

yCpYrSyLQbweCSVflItfzA.text: Amazing food. Amazing (male) server. Awesome Baja sauce. And the authentic Mexico feel. A must visit if you haven't been!

vhE7BMoLIzN-gebOLOsgNw.text: This is my favorite Mexican food restaurant. The food is excellent. I especially like how the combo plate that I usually get(#101) comes loaded with extra cheese on the top. The salsa is exactly how my family likes it. It's got a nice "bite" to it but not too hot. Service is fast. Water and chips/salsa get refilled without waiting. Atmosphere is not the best but the food is what keeps us coming back.

9_WQgfqRXazLLwnJURhZ3A.text: I really liked this restaurant, the food was so good. I was very disappointed in the Mango Margarita, when I took a drink the only thing I tasted was salt and no mango. I will be returning but was very disappointed that when I left the front cashier know about the issue she just said "oh yeah our strawberry margarita is the popular one" and made no attempt to right it.

QNsmqgZ2ic4woSgNNhmrEA.text: Although the large amount of sauce and cheese can disguise the truth, the food that I have tried here is low quality and lacks flavor. Was with a group of six and everyone agreed. Also had one of the cheap margaritas, which was nothing special. Just what you would expect from a $1.50 margarita   I am pretty sure the salsa was made using canned tomatoes.   I would not recommend.

jKr7cckiwwn35SxnCbKFBw.text: Welp!! The Food was pretty darn good, I just don't know what they were thinking having one gal wait on 6 tables.  She obviously was overwhelmed, or just not trained well.  She was more focused on seating new customers and bringing out food, then she was bringing the check.

0BfBL4LyWdkAc6dC0FWX1A.text: Food was very good and my margarita wasn't bad.  I had the beef enchiladas, one in red sauce and one in green. They were tasty as was the rice and beans. Service was average. The only reason for loosing a star was the limited menu. Waiter was engaging and discussed the two sauces on my plate. He asked for my opinion on preference.

8mLHOc8c1PVDBcV5H9yImQ.text: ISO: Great Mexican food that's quick, a hop skip & jump away and is inexpensive, but not in the "I ate 'Berto's drunk last night, and it's not the booze that left me feeling like crap"  way.  This place is pretty dive-y and at first glance, you'd think "Meh..nothing to write home about". Don't judge a book by it's cover! Mi Patio serves up classic Mexican fare with a Greek twist. The first time I got the complimentary chips and salsa, I was sold-AND might I mention that it's bottomless? We'd be halfway finished with a bowl of chips and someone would be making rounds to give us more! The margaritas are pretty standard-I'm not a huge margarita drinker but I always order one when I come here-why not? It's only $1.75. I know what you're thinking. Hold the phone! 1.75? Was it Happy Hour? NOPE..It's all the time!   Usually when I go, I've ordered the veggie burro. On my most recent visit, the special was fish tacos.. This girl is a huge fan of those! The portions here are huge-especially with the burros. I usually power halfway through because it's so good I can't stop eating and then am stuffed.  They seem to make the food at record pace and all of the ingredients taste fresh. The fish tacos I ordered were SO tasty-I had never had them with fresh taco shells..mmm mm good!! Plus the beans and rice which is always delicious. I'd probably eat here every day if I could..or if it were particularly healthy.

OqYYR7US0XEchlcsixba1A.text: Do not go there !!! I literally just left . The bartender stated the margaritas were watered down but they are cheap so people buy them. It would be nice place if they had better selection of food and better service. At least he was being honest that the half ass do their work.

wuqraeNyQe7YuWvjx64FtQ.text: Let me start by saying I have always LOVED this place. I placed a order to go yesterday and I was so disappointed with my To Go Order, A Veggie Burrito was stone cold, no heat what so ever and no red sauce as I requested was placed on top. I wont be back for a while. I was so sad by the taste of the burrito that I could not even eat it, no love in it. So Sad :(

DW68bQKPpeqjLiNEfwOvYA.text: came in on a Saturday night and sat at the bar. Brian was our bartender and I just want to give him a shout out for his excellent service! our chips and salsa were never empty, the drinks were cold and the food was hot. everything was yummy and we enjoyed our time here very much. thanks Brian and mi patio!

BX_ZNGXSMYxgh0-M-mcTng.text: Best tacos this side of Heaven. Nummers! I've already been there twice in 7 days because I was thinning about the Amazingness of those things. Refried brands and delicious and the rice is nice. Ha! See what I did there. The Margaritas are delicious too. Clean establishment and the staff is friendly. Don't try to turn around in the bathroom though lol. Finally on Friday nights it gets packed for happy hour and you won't be disappointed.

JzMRldn1GOLGG5BDfT0FJQ.text: Visited Mi Patio because of the great Yelp reviews and was definitely not disappointed!    1. Great Food- the chips & salsa to start off was delicious!  We ordered the chicken chimi plate, Combo plate with cheese enchilada and carne asada,  Happy Hour Margarita, & Fruit Margarita.  Everything was delicious and authentic Mexican food!  Rice and beans were delicious too.  I have already sent a couple of families to try it out & one friend even had it catered at her baby shower!  2. AMAZING Service- Our server was great!  Helpful, kind, and provided top notch service without being intrusive on our meal!  3. Wonderful Experience- ambiance was as expected.  Comfortable seating and decorations were Mexican themed with Halloween decorations (It's October) that my toddler loved.  The service, food, and employees were all great!!  And the bathrooms were clean (this is super important, in my opinion).  We will definitely come back regularly.

ceBqWMdAw7tyFvCINZ7iPQ.text: Great service! Family friendly, affordable drinks and cozy environment. Awesome neighborhood restaurant if you're in downtown phoenix.

HvRHoyaCTovFSC_XsP4Nng.text: So where do I start?  First there is plenty of parking.  The restaurant was clean, spacious, and filled with amazing decor.  We were greeted promptly by a young women with a nice smile and seated us to our table.  The the waiter was friendly and quick, took our drink order, bought chips, and came back to get our food order very fast.  The chips and salsa  was never ending and I mean they fill and top off with out you asking.  The food came out hot and so delicious.  Will be coming back more.

photos.caption: Photo of Mi Patio - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Yummy in my tummy!!!

eq2xUkwdtnwwgXdyXwaRJw.text: This is a very family local place. The service is attentive. The food is tasty. Maybe the best salsa I've ever had. Perfect fresh flavor, perfect chunkage and spice level. The chicken fajita plate was so delicious. Refried beans were piled on w cheese. Honestly it was one of the best Mexican meals in memory. Portions were huge and they are very accommodating about substitutions. Hooray!

_geqaMhWnRq_zebnCZKS4A.text: Great food & Great service  My spouse and I were in town for a few days and decided to try this place out. We were greeted with great pricing, excellent food and spectacular service! Our waiter ever brought us a free shot before we left! Would recommend 10 times over.

lqTG_EK8z7H36_GWgXhybA.text: Good Mexican good. Love the beans and rice. I usually get shredded beef taco combo and partner gets bean and cheese burrito enchilada style. Definitely one of our favorite neighborhood spots.

9B0FjtgRtgSeFkEXNbZEcA.text: I've had this place bookmarked for weeks and today I was finally able to try it. The moment my daughter and I walked in we were instantly greeted with a big smile and hello from the hostess and seated right away. We were instantly seated, our drink orders taken, and fresh (still warm) tortilla chips with some yummy salsa. After a few hard minutes trying to decide what to get I decided on the carnitas. My daughter orders some shredded beef tacos. Our waiter was very attentive and just as friendly as the hostess. Our drinks were never empty and our chips were filled the second they got low. The food came out so fast and I was so surprised. It looked and smelled fabulous! The first bite to the last was amazing. My daughter said her tacos were the most flavorful and juicy she's ever had. I can't wait to come back. This was the greatest service I've ever had at any restaurant in Phoenix I've ever been to. The food was phenomenal and you can tell there were many regulars dining with us.

phc9ZIZCXTppHynnSlAbJA.text: Restaurant has amazing food, great service, well priced and my vote for best Mexican Restaurant in town.

twya_j1_YkaFMi5ECc3ZFg.text: Stopped in for a chicken burro enchilada style, since this is on my way home from work.  My favorite place for these is Manuel's on Indian School, just didn't want to drive that far.  Service was fine, but burro was watery and not nearly as tasty as Manuel's.  Will look for another place along the Central corridor.  Any suggestions?

98CIQOJgYKmZpYFmjnkiHA.text: Gave this place a try before heading out to a bar. It was great. Huge portions and decent prices. They are not afraid to give you your cream or cheese. Free chips and salsa which isn't too bad. Beer and drinks were cold and keep in mind they have a full bar. Not typical in a small venue like that.  Service was good and fast.  I will definitely be coming back.

21V46h1uMVog7o0ZAQZH-A.text: Fabulous local gem that has been around for decades!!! Simple, fresh ingredients! Fast service! Very affordable! It's just a nice local no frills kind of place with a cute bar!

KrPsXiz7QJ-yhJnamXMwcA.text: Double Dipping Allowed.  Sometimes you can't judge a book by its cover.  This is True about Mi Patio Mexican Grill. The restaurant may not be  much to look at from the outside, however it's definitely worth going in.  Your greeted the moment you walk in the door by staff that are very friendly and inviting.  Once seated you are immediately served a large bowl of warm chips and salsa.  The chips and salsa at Mi Patio Mexican Grill are  fresh and so addicting. What I liked best is  each person gets their own bowl of salsa, so double dip all you want and believe me you will want to.  The salsa at Mi Patio is the best I've had in a very long time.  The portions at Mi Patio are huge. I ordered a taco and enchilada combination plate  and could not finish my entree. I haven't found a cheese enchilada any where near this good.   Price are reasonable and service excellent.  I would definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone that enjoys mexican food.

photos.caption: Photo of Mi Patio - Phoenix, AZ, United States

lOeMUlFPkskU4t1JDHZJ0w.text: Alright, this place isn't too bad. Overall the food is great tasting. Good flavor with decent heat. The service is good and the beer is kept on ice, that's rare.   I suggest asking for no garnish on the dish. The food is stand-alone but they pile on the lettuce, sour cream and guacamole. They really need a small bit of each and some cilantro for looks.   Recommend coming here. And this comes from a latino, born and raised in northern New Mexico.

zHhVhyzWAdvkaRjqZYMpTA.text: So good, home style Mexican. Gets crowded but it's worth the wait. Cheap margaritas and cheap tasty food. Everything on the menu is good. I like the pollo queso.  Chips are hot and fresh.

The service was great, and at the end of our meal our waiter surprised us with a cranberry shooter on the house, which was also crazy good. Overall, we had a wonderful experience and would highly recommend Mi Patio.   PS. we haven't stopped saying 'mi patio' our whole trip.

0XUARGSFF2H6YqZKQhQ07Q.text: Service was great, the Micheladas were great, and the food was good. I got the enchilada, relleno and beef taco combo. River and beans we tasty, but they put waaaaay too much cheese even for a cheese lover.

BPoVm049z8-TxqMCsL1JdQ.text: May I say whaoooo This place it's amazing!!!, Mouth watering crispy tacos, perfect Spanish rice, cheese beans, and 2,75 dlls margaritas, not just any margarita. great flavor & good size! To tops it off we had the best waiter ever ( I think his name was Daniel) So attentive, fun, and helpful.  Looking forward to come back many times!

Y7BOgzR3S3k1K3Y-8kgzRA.text: We just moved a needed a new go-to mexican restaurant, and this is it! Fresh filtered water, chips, and salsa hit the table as soon as we sat down. We were never without instant refills! I ordered the vegetarian burro and my husband ordered two enchiladas, one cheese and one chicken in red sauce. We also ordered guac and green enchilada sauce on the side to taste. All their enchilada sauce are the best I've ever tasted, really good depth of flavor, and their guac was simple but yummy. I am so happy I found a place that has something for vegetarians/ vegans to eat. My burro had beans, rice, guac, lettuce/cabbage mix, onions, cilantro, and pico. It was HUGE and it was delicious! It was supposed to come with cheese, but I ordered it without (lactose intolerant!).   Overall great atmosphere, great service, and yummy food! Their claim to fame is their $2ish dollar house margaritas, which I didn't sample, but plenty of other people were ordering them!   Parking lot is pretty tiny, normal for Phoenix, so come after the dinner rush (7ish) and it should be emptying out, or go for an early dinner! Would highly recommend, and of you have a vegan/vegetarian friend and have no clue where to take them, now you do and a menu item to recommend!

cc6egQ0_A-Danp0XrkDc-Q.text: Growing up with Macayo's has given me a love of all things which include baja sauce, and this place does it very well. Not authentic Mexican food, but great for when you're looking for something better than Berto's. Their portions are large and between their baja burrito and their patio chimi there's no going wrong.   They're not exactly packed with natural flavor but their sauces are quite good. They will fall short if you're looking for spice, even Berto's has hotter red sauce but if you're looking for something like Macayo's then you'll be pleasantly surprised.   They offer quick take out, or you can dine in and partake their incredible cheap margaritas. I've also heard they have a phenomenal happy hour. There's plenty of parking, and a large dining area, but it does get pretty packed for that happy hour. I love that they're open late and include chips even for take out!  The laat time we dined in the owner gave my boyfriend and I two complimentary shots as well, so this place definitely gets a thumbs up in my opinion.

0QU1diPYZakDDGCrULREHw.text: What is the deal with this place? Probably the most bland Mexican food I've ever eaten. I had the chicken tacos- tasted like they just cooked the chicken and shredded it with no seasoning.

8_PVW5rNZC_DB0-vclOhWQ.text: Mediocre Service and food at best . Although I will be eager to try it again as they have a Greek menu

680UYYyki73UtkpNsXdZXQ.text: Great place for Mexican with a homey feel.  Plenty to chose from. This place is authentic as any and they have great staff, I had enchiladas which were excellent!

UXTtjyjDPNiQoq389zYkMw.text: Never again! You walk in thinking its going to be great mexican food. Oh boy was I wrong. There was no flavor at all. I was so disappointed because it looked so good. Everything was just so plain, everything needed more salt and salsa anything really it give it flavor.

kAtg1bHJAE0S5kXwxPXBSQ.text: Been coming here for years. Cant attest personally to the the items on the menu, because I only order the Baja Chicken Burro. It is my favorite Mexican food dish. If you come for anything , try it.

y2mM_4syxYLX7sd4vUt9fw.text: I can't agree with the 561 people who gave this restaurant a 4 star review.  The blue Hawaiian margarita was made with rubbing alcohol, like hobo strength rubbing alcohol. The nachos and the flautas were good, but not great.  Overall this place was okay, but I won't be going back.

JVxFcUPhb8LTOdd6eiU1XQ.text: Best Mexican I have had in a long, long time. I live in the New York area and we have some excellent Mexican restaurants here. This definitely beats a lot of them. The food is well-prepared, honest, unpretentious, and just darn good. We stumbled across this looking for lunch near our hotel and were all very pleased with it. The service was prompt and the atmosphere is friendly. Definitely recommend this place.

D8iqTam3Y9AWMWhWJPGf5A.text: We are at the Fairgrounds and looked for a place to have dinner. Read the reviews and decided to try Mi Patio.  We're glad we did.   While waiting for our food we were served the customary taco chips & salsa. The salsa was excellent - tasty with just enough bite.  The chips were nicely warmed too. Refills appeared as soon as the chips or salsa was getting close to the end - no waiting here. The ambience was pleasant,  clean & cheerful.   I had the Mi Patio chili. It was delicious, my wife had the chicken burro Baja.  It,  too,  was tasty.   Service was spot on and there was no skimping of food.  Definitely worth visiting this place. Definitely worth 4 stars

EbAYBqCQFKKkA8s61T4DuA.text: Awesome spot! Looked up on Yelp for a Hispanic place to eat in the area. We were stuck in traffic and  stumbled this gem. Felt super welcomed when we first came in. Super friendly and family oriented. Food from Yelp looked so good. The menu had everything too. We had the baja chicken burrito (chicken chimichanga) and the Machaca taco salad. Both our meals were amazing . Chips were warm and they kept refilling it and I couldn't stop lol. Same with the salsa, they kept filling it up at the table and of course I literally drank it. El Patio is added to out foodie list. Garcias! We will be back!

sDuPbPAvk9JuPhah1ZMZcQ.text: Stopped in for lunch, sat at the bar where I met Brian, he was a delight, we had an awesome conversation on healthy living and food. I ordered the spinach enchalada and an iced t the portion was big enough to satisfy my appetite and box up the rest. This was my second time and it went be my last. Thanks again Brian "What the health."

bkCJp-DBthwf8a7R6StVPw.text: Positives: I love me some good Mexican food and this place did not disappoint! It started off with PERFECT chips... the salsa was also yummy.  If I didn't run out I'd probably still be eating it.  The salsa did not have any heat but the flavor was amazing.  My friend and I got 2 entrees and shared.  The chicken Baja burrito was drenched in an amazing white sauce.  We also got a plate with shredded beef tacos and a cheese enchilada. Both were perfection.  Best red enchilada sauce I think I've had.. as well as the rice! I'm not sure I've ever had such moist and flavorful Mexican rice?!! You actually want to finish it all off your plate.   We were greeted by a super friendly hello and goodbye.  An all over great experience.   Negatives: I have none.  However if you like a spice to your salsa you may want to ask them to spice it up.

Photo of Mi Patio - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Baja chicken burrito.. yummy goodness

gdXI_DrHi4B4ZC6hF497Sg.text: The food and service was excellent. I'd come here again. Authentic Mexican food. I had the green corn tamales and they were very good. Their salsa is delicious. No complaints. I'll be a repeat customer when in this area again.

hLcjjo-9SsF_7HicjC6wpA.text: I entered Mi Patio looking to have an awesome Mexican lunch and I left Mi Patio wondering what I just ate.  The options are generic Mexican dishes,  flautas, tacos, burritos, quesadillas, etc.  Being a simple menu with high ratings I figured the food would be spot on.  I placed my order; fish flautas and a jamaica.  Unfortunately they do not serve jamaica so that was substituted with water.        While I waited a bowl of chips and salsa were brought over.  The chips were nice and thin, kinda that classic restaurant style but the salsa was very watery, mild in flavor, and not very appealing.  The wait for my food was quite long for such a simple meal but it did eventually show up, and to my surprise it wasn't  exactly "good".      The flautas were extremely dry, the fish was very much overcooked and almost as dry as the tortilla.  The "pesto" was bland and added nothing to the dish, it was more a gimmick than flavor and it made absolutely no sense to have it there.  The rice was seasoned so heavily with oregano that I couldn't taste anything else after having some the best part of the meal had to be the beans, because they were simply that, just beans.      I have to say "disappointment" is the only word to describe this place.  It's no better than a Mexican fast food restaurant and in fact is a bit worse considering the long wait for food, the only real difference is the liquor license.  There are much better options in the vicinity so unless it's you're only option take a hard pass.

photos.caption: Photo of Mi Patio - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fish flautas.

c5Bl8MAdpBoaEi4l4X_TGw.text: Came here on a Saturday night a little after 9:30pm.   Was visiting Phoenix for the weekend from out of state and turned to yelp for help on suggestions on a late night dinner.  Mi Patio's 4 star rating and proximity to my location made this restaurant an easy pick.  However, shortly after sitting down we where told that the kitchen would be closing in 10 minutes. Perhaps that was the reason for the quality of the food we received.  I ordered the machaca chimi with beans in the side.  This dish was not bad, but not great.  My friend ordered beef tacos and rice.  The beef was flavorless and somewhat tough, and the rice ------- was horrible!  It tasted burnt and funky.  That dish was a complete fail.  I ordered the $2.79 margaritas since they proudly advertise this special via a banner outside the restaurant.  This was a very disappointing - all I had was sugar and no alcohol, a complete waste of money.  I didn't even finish it.  Perhaps it was the fact that we arrived near closing or maybe this is what their food really is like.  I find the rating for this establishment completely deceiving - an epic fail.  I would not recommend this place at this point.  I wish I could suggest a different place to grab some delicious and outstanding Mexican food, but since I'm not from Phoenix  and was visiting on a whim - I cannot.

bKJNj_dJhGUGqo7Gx-Uyig.text: Good Mexican food, everything was reasonably priced. Extremely good prices for alcohol. Would go again.

eg-xragCgvuVn9rM_7qRdg.text: Absolutely horrible. The only thing that was yummy were the chips and salsa. They smother melted cheese on top of almost all your plate to hide the old and tasteless good on your plate. Our carne asada tasted like it had been defrosted in the microwave right after we ordered it.  More like jerky than steak. And then the beef tacos were chewy and also had a funny frozen meat taste. We are still on a mission to find delicious tacos here in Phoenix. Frustrating considering we are only a few hours from Mexico. Oh well. This place definitely isn't it.

OQ_TdxquGByAuMTchiFNSQ.text: Great service and the food was AMAZING! I am very pleased with the service. I especially liked how I never had to ask for more water or salsa! This was the best Mexican food I have tried in Phoenix so far!!

gvqBioNLYOmPyyhDhLubpw.text: Nice generous portions and the staff was very attentive. Food was very well done and came out quickly. Laid back restaurant.

nnU0Jj4zbTR1B0ovlctv6w.text: Best margarita in town and only $1.99 definitely recommend it! If you're ever over this way stop in for a delicious cheap margarita. The food and service are great as well

ItHvl5L-tx1uzuFB7Dp2KQ.text: Food was delicious! I got combo 100 which has a tamale, taco and cheese enchilada with rice and beans.  It was only like $12 and it was bomb!  Friends got the Baja burrito and loved it.  They also got a cheese crisp which was like the size of a large pizza.

SuE-_S3sGhmaHfz0hl1F4g.text: Went here for the first time and did take out ordered carne asada tacos special w/ rice and beans was really good also got chips and salsa on the side for free!!! Loved the salsa!

yW6SNdHl_ssE9MKprCsa0w.text: Waitress was yelling orders.  When I complained,  she said the use the old system,  which is yelling.  Quite unsettling when your trying to eat dinner.  The chili reno was decent, but the steak was horrible.   The chips were stupid stale.  Like they had been left out all day with a fan on them.  This place was a waste of money.

v3AABpPNfPw35yxJ1oDvwg.text: Like everyone has mentioned- this place has to be the go to spot for mexican in north central phoenix.  We went here for the first time Sunday after seeing how busy the parking lot always is and were greatly impressed with the amazing attentive service, traditional great mexican food with large portions!

fv2A1x1AiX9qFXOFelkU9w.text: The margarita are good and I've never had one so strong! The food was good. The 5 stars are for the drinks, salsa and fast service! The food 3 stras!

O6e05WsCgkRAhY8ds_XpNA.text: I am sitting at this restaurant writing this review of the worst Mexican food I have ever had.  The Guacamole is from a packet, the beef taquitos and tacos are dryer than the Mojave  desert.  The flautas were stale and had the texture of a 3 month year old deep fried corn tortilla. The salsa and soda were the best things to enjoy at this establishment.  The waitress and service was nice but my god the food is horrible. I should have known when you walk in and see mostly Caucasian people eating your probably in the wrong place with no Hispanics dining.  The Spanish rice is definitely from a box and not fresh.  Very very sad. I won't be back. I suggest eating at Ritos Mexican kitchen. I'm still hungry  and will probably chew on one of my flip flops or my daughters tennis shoe which either one would be more edible, fresher and tastier. Good luck to everyone but that's just my opinion.

jWuXj29cn7mDClRNzBswWA.text: Good food and service. Small place but very busy as they have been around awhile and food is close to authentic Mexican. Margaritas are on special all day but since they are premaid they taste like there's no alcohol. A renovation to look clean and updated would help revive feel of place.

meUjVLrFXFqy_6ncPUXuOw.text: Best nachos I've ever had. They're fast and efficient. The service was great. Back to the nachos.... Cheesy, meaty, saucy, and perfect. The condiments came on the side which was unusual but much appreciated. Their enchiladas were super cheesy, the sauce was yummy and homemade. The hot sauce tasted just like Valentina hot sauce but the homemade version. Our server was sweet, a little rushed at first but we came in at the end of a lunch rush. It didn't affect how quickly everything got to is though. Highly recommend this place.

Photo of Mi Patio - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Best nachos of my life.

3MA-UfamtDg00FwzuvRGaA.text: VERY DISAPPOINTING!!! I don't know what kind of mexican food the yelpers are having....but I got food I could have gotten @ filiberto's for 4 times the price!!! Rice was dry, the flautas weren't flautas but taquitos.....WON'T be back!!!

6Ngl-ci5PposSjNUVpXlHQ.text: Great little place with super fast service. Many repeat customers and locals, friendly staff.  I had the baja chicken and it was really good! Not overly smothered in sauce, get fresh flavors, and a great portion for the money.  Chips and salsa were never ending, and the staff was very friendly and attentive!

0BCAhxkaxkY6vdiumj1MsA.text: Living just a half mile away for the past few years, I really had no excuse to avoiding Mi Patio for so long. I tend to stay away from any place that chips are considered a course in your meal and deep fried is a cooking method. While I still stick to this mothodology, its nice to break pace every few weeks to keep your sanity. I mean, you cant live on veggies for too long without getting a craving for something tasty, meaty, and full of carbs.  Mi Patio was just the spot. We ordered a spinach and cheese chimi and a couple orders of their tacos; chicken and beef. After filling up on chips and chowing down the great tasting tacos, we couldn't even begin to eat the chimi. While my expectations for a next day chimichanga wasn't so high up there, it was actually still good the next day. I imagine that it would have been all the better had I eaten it fresh from the kitchen. Maybe next time ill go light on the chips. Ive heard their $1.75 margaritas a decent; however, I cannot personally attest to this. At $1.75 it can't hurt to give it a try though.   Either way you slice it, Mi Patio is a solid choice for your Mexican delights.

fo_-1gMwnTxFGjiOaI14Pw.text: Our waiter Freddy was awesome! However the food was just okay- nothing amazing. We also got margaritas and they didn't seem very strong, but nice Freddy helped us out and gave us extra tequila. Their salsa was really good!

73hNteejNb9leQzjQEoMAg.text: AMAZING!! The restaurant is very unassuming, a small joint, but they have the best food, very tasty, and the service is beyond awesome. You truly feel like family here! My partner and I had enchiladas, tacos and tostada platters. The chips were nice and warm and the salsa was on point. Great place, and inexpensive!! Give it a shot!

Kn4OZfK2yqg-sVlQQtH1ZQ.text: That had me at $3.99 grande margarita!! And then...followed that up with delicious house made salsa and chips. Combo plates are the way to go. We had #97 and #100. Tacos, enchiladas, tamales & chile rellenos were very tasty and the portions were generous. All of the staff are so friendly. Look for Elio. Great guy!! He's behind the bar Saturday for lunch.

uiww3b5BN3QfdDoGRUtW2w.text: Best Mexican spot in Phoenix. Hands down.   Best parts about Mi Patio: -service. You can be seated, ordered, eat ad leave within 45 minutes, and that is with the free shot they sometimes give you! -price. You can go to plenty of other highly rated places and pay double the price....and this is better food. -fam owned-most of the people have worked there forever. They remember the regulars orders (and this place is so good there are a lot of regulars)  Favorite Food: -beef tacos-delicious. You can request with onions and tomatoes otherwise it comes with lettuce and cheese. I recommend #96-two tacos, beans and cheese. Mixing the beans together and adding a little hot sauce on top is delicious. **if you order this for pickup or to go it is a $1 cheaper by the way!** #106 Is another good combo. -Baja chicken burro. Oh my god delicious. This dish is all about the sauce. It goes so well together. **you can ask for the sauce on anything I learned by the way -chips and salsa are constantly being replenished and are so yummy and homemade   If I had to find negatives/to be straight up: -not my favorite guacamole. Not a lot of flavor. -quesadillas aren't always that crispy -margs aren't the strongest or made with the too ingredients but they are cheap and still yummy. Ask for a double with not too much ice!  This is by far the best Mexican food I have found in AZ. I never leave disappointed. The food is great ad you any best the service and prices.

sQzPh7v-WTqndfYkVp1jXg.text: If it wasn't for it's great service I would have rate it a 2 star.  The good part of this restaurant is that they give you big portions; however, the bad thing is that the food is too greasy and mediocre.  To their credit, they are better than many Mexican restaurants in the city.  They are, however, not the best in town.  The margaritas are tasty but will get you as buzzed as much as a glass of lemonade will.  Whatever you do, do not try the chicken poblano, unless you like the taste of prune juice.

cXG0f924TcOgrFZVrphoIg.text: Great food, super fast service and good prices! I ordered the red chili combination plate, which was amazing! Even the chips tasted like they were freshly made. The salsa was fantastic. Overall, one fine place to eat for great Mexican food!

57ZwrWoAV-Ue3rtEOM_ffw.text: Best service I've had in a while, and the food was great. Refilla of tortilla chips before you can think to ask = heaven.

Dc7Jw_jboMr9azELqSguqA.text: This is one of my favorite Mexican restaurants in the valley. I wish they would open more locations although they are well worth the drive to central Phoenix! Salsa is great and I love their enchiladas! The prices are really great and the staff is always very friendly.

ncGuQf_LJCPikCrj9mknGg.text: I'm just gonna come out and say it, there is not enough tequila in Mexico, nor will there ever be, to be make this food even edible. I am not a picky eater, I ordered the Patio Chimi, which had an awful tomatillo sauce. It was oddly sweet. My mother ordered the green chile beef, that seemed to be missing beef and tasted like no Mexican food we've ever eaten. Her and I had to try and move the food around the plate to even make it look like we ate anything. The service was terrible. The staff seemed extremely indifferent towards the guests.   We are both first generation Mexican and this food was almost offensive, and to be quite honest, you can get better food at any Mexican fast food place.   We are not from Phoenix, but next time we are out here we will not be eating here, ever again.

MPPJ_hz7EaC386RFdX36bg.text: Mi Patio is good. For the area that it is in, I find it strange that there isn't more competition in Mexican food. I guess I could head deeper into the aves but, as a rule of thumb, I don't associate the Avenues with solutions.   From the outside, I was concerned that we were walking into a canned beans, store-bought hard taco shells, overpriced experience. In retrospect, this is probably due to the Corona theme on the outside of the building that made me think of all the substandard Mexican joints in Tempe that survive off the binge drinking college crowd. So, shame on me for such judgement - authentic Mexican doesn't have to come from a rundown brink building in a south Phoenix barrio.  Promptly seated, the service was attentive and the food was good. I got my panfried taco shell (complete with bubbled sides - muy authentico!) and left fat and happy. I think Mi Patio may be our new go-to Mexican place when we don't want to drive all the way to the South Phoenix Barrio.
